125QApplicationPrivate::QApplicationPrivate(int &argc, char **argv)
126 : QGuiApplicationPrivate(argc, argv)
127{
128 application_type = QApplicationPrivate::Gui;
129
130#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
131 gestureManager = nullptr;
132 gestureWidget = nullptr;
133#endif // QT_NO_GESTURES
134
135 if (!self)
136 self = this;
137}
138
139QApplicationPrivate::~QApplicationPrivate()
140{
141 if (self == this)
142 self = nullptr;
143}

150/*!
151 \class QApplication
152 \brief The QApplication class manages the GUI application's control
153 flow and main settings.
154
155 \inmodule QtWidgets
156
157 QApplication specializes QGuiApplication with some functionality needed
158 for QWidget-based applications. It handles widget specific initialization,
159 finalization.
160
161 For any GUI application using Qt, there is precisely \b one QApplication
162 object, no matter whether the application has 0, 1, 2 or more windows at
163 any given time. For non-QWidget based Qt applications, use QGuiApplication instead,
164 as it does not depend on the \l QtWidgets library.
165
166 Some GUI applications provide a special batch mode ie. provide command line
167 arguments for executing tasks without manual intervention. In such non-GUI
168 mode, it is often sufficient to instantiate a plain QCoreApplication to
169 avoid unnecessarily initializing resources needed for a graphical user
170 interface. The following example shows how to dynamically create an
171 appropriate type of application instance:
172
173 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qapplication.cpp 0
174
175 The QApplication object is accessible through the instance() function that
176 returns a pointer equivalent to the global qApp pointer.
177
178 QApplication's main areas of responsibility are:
179 \list
180 \li It initializes the application with the user's desktop settings
181 such as palette(), font() and doubleClickInterval(). It keeps
182 track of these properties in case the user changes the desktop
183 globally, for example through some kind of control panel.
184
185 \li It performs event handling, meaning that it receives events
186 from the underlying window system and dispatches them to the
187 relevant widgets. By using sendEvent() and postEvent() you can
188 send your own events to widgets.
189
190 \li It parses common command line arguments and sets its internal
191 state accordingly. See the \l{QApplication::QApplication()}
192 {constructor documentation} below for more details.
193
194 \li It defines the application's look and feel, which is
195 encapsulated in a QStyle object. This can be changed at runtime
196 with setStyle().
197
198 \li It provides localization of strings that are visible to the
199 user via translate().
200
201 \li It provides some magical objects like the clipboard().
202
203 \li It knows about the application's windows. You can ask which
204 widget is at a certain position using widgetAt(), get a list of
205 topLevelWidgets() and closeAllWindows(), etc.
206
207 \li It manages the application's mouse cursor handling, see
208 setOverrideCursor()
209 \endlist
210
211 Since the QApplication object does so much initialization, it \e{must} be
212 created before any other objects related to the user interface are created.
213 QApplication also deals with common command line arguments. Hence, it is
214 usually a good idea to create it \e before any interpretation or
215 modification of \c argv is done in the application itself.
216
217 \table
218 \header
219 \li{2,1} Groups of functions
220
221 \row
222 \li System settings
223 \li desktopSettingsAware(),
224 setDesktopSettingsAware(),
225 cursorFlashTime(),
226 setCursorFlashTime(),
227 doubleClickInterval(),
228 setDoubleClickInterval(),
229 setKeyboardInputInterval(),
230 wheelScrollLines(),
231 setWheelScrollLines(),
232 palette(),
233 setPalette(),
234 font(),
235 setFont(),
236 fontMetrics().
237
238 \row
239 \li Event handling
240 \li exec(),
241 processEvents(),
242 exit(),
243 quit().
244 sendEvent(),
245 postEvent(),
246 sendPostedEvents(),
247 removePostedEvents(),
248 notify().
249
250 \row
251 \li GUI Styles
252 \li style(),
253 setStyle().
254
255 \row
256 \li Text handling
257 \li installTranslator(),
258 removeTranslator()
259 translate().
260
261 \row
262 \li Widgets
263 \li allWidgets(),
264 topLevelWidgets(),
265 activePopupWidget(),
266 activeModalWidget(),
267 clipboard(),
268 focusWidget(),
269 activeWindow(),
270 widgetAt().
271
272 \row
273 \li Advanced cursor handling
274 \li overrideCursor(),
275 setOverrideCursor(),
276 restoreOverrideCursor().
277
278 \row
279 \li Miscellaneous
280 \li closeAllWindows(),
281 startingUp(),
282 closingDown().
283 \endtable
284
285 \sa QCoreApplication, QAbstractEventDispatcher, QEventLoop, QSettings
286*/
287
288/*!
289 \fn QWidget *QApplication::topLevelAt(const QPoint &point)
290
291 Returns the top-level widget at the given \a point; returns \nullptr if
292 there is no such widget.
293*/
294QWidget *QApplication::topLevelAt(const QPoint &pos)
295{
296 if (const QWindow *window = QGuiApplication::topLevelAt(pos)) {
297 if (const QWidgetWindow *widgetWindow = qobject_cast<const QWidgetWindow *>(object: window))
298 return widgetWindow->widget();
299 }
300 return nullptr;
301}

309 0 if there is no such widget.
310*/

340inline bool QApplicationPrivate::isAlien(QWidget *widget)
341{

360/*!
361 \internal
362*/
363void QApplicationPrivate::process_cmdline()
364{
365 if (styleOverride.isEmpty() && qEnvironmentVariableIsSet(varName: "QT_STYLE_OVERRIDE"))
366 styleOverride = QString::fromLocal8Bit(ba: qgetenv(varName: "QT_STYLE_OVERRIDE"));
367
368 // process platform-indep command line
369 if (qt_is_tty_app || !argc)
370 return;
371
372 int i, j;
373
374 j = 1;
375 for (i=1; i<argc; i++) { // if you add anything here, modify QCoreApplication::arguments()
376 if (!argv[i])
377 continue;
378 if (*argv[i] != '-') {
379 argv[j++] = argv[i];
380 continue;
381 }
382 const char *arg = argv[i];
383 if (arg[1] == '-') // startsWith("--")
384 ++arg;
385 if (strcmp(s1: arg, s2: "-qdevel") == 0 || strcmp(s1: arg, s2: "-qdebug") == 0) {
386 // obsolete argument
387#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
388 } else if (strcmp(s1: arg, s2: "-stylesheet") == 0 && i < argc -1) {
389 styleSheet = "file:///"_L1;
390 styleSheet.append(s: QString::fromLocal8Bit(ba: argv[++i]));
391 } else if (strncmp(s1: arg, s2: "-stylesheet=", n: 12) == 0) {
392 styleSheet = "file:///"_L1;
393 styleSheet.append(s: QString::fromLocal8Bit(ba: arg + 12));
394#endif
395 } else if (qstrcmp(str1: arg, str2: "-widgetcount") == 0) {
396 widgetCount = true;
397 } else {
398 argv[j++] = argv[i];
399 }
400 }
401
402 if (j < argc) {
403 argv[j] = nullptr;
404 argc = j;
405 }
406}
407
408/*!
409 Initializes the window system and constructs an application object with
410 \a argc command line arguments in \a argv.
411
412 \warning The data referred to by \a argc and \a argv must stay valid for
413 the entire lifetime of the QApplication object. In addition, \a argc must
414 be greater than zero and \a argv must contain at least one valid character
415 string.
416
417 The global \c qApp pointer refers to this application object. Only one
418 application object should be created.
419
420 This application object must be constructed before any \l{QPaintDevice}
421 {paint devices} (including widgets, pixmaps, bitmaps etc.).
422
423 \note \a argc and \a argv might be changed as Qt removes command line
424 arguments that it recognizes.
425
426 All Qt programs automatically support the following command line options:
427 \list
428 \li -style= \e style, sets the application GUI style. Possible values
429 depend on your system configuration. If you compiled Qt with
430 additional styles or have additional styles as plugins these will
431 be available to the \c -style command line option. You can also
432 set the style for all Qt applications by setting the
433 \c QT_STYLE_OVERRIDE environment variable.
434 \li -style \e style, is the same as listed above.
435 \li -stylesheet= \e stylesheet, sets the application \l styleSheet. The
436 value must be a path to a file that contains the Style Sheet.
437 \note Relative URLs in the Style Sheet file are relative to the
438 Style Sheet file's path.
439 \li -stylesheet \e stylesheet, is the same as listed above.
440 \li -widgetcount, prints debug message at the end about number of
441 widgets left undestroyed and maximum number of widgets existed at
442 the same time
443 \li -reverse, sets the application's layout direction to
444 Qt::RightToLeft
445 \li -qmljsdebugger=, activates the QML/JS debugger with a specified port.
446 The value must be of format port:1234[,block], where block is optional
447 and will make the application wait until a debugger connects to it.
448 \endlist
449
450 \sa QCoreApplication::arguments()
451*/
452
453#ifdef Q_QDOC
454QApplication::QApplication(int &argc, char **argv)
455#else
456QApplication::QApplication(int &argc, char **argv, int)
457#endif
458 : QGuiApplication(*new QApplicationPrivate(argc, argv))
459{
460 Q_D(QApplication);
461 d->init();
462}
463
464/*!
465 \internal
466*/
467void QApplicationPrivate::init()
468{
469#if defined(Q_OS_MACOS)
470 QMacAutoReleasePool pool;
471#endif
472
473 QGuiApplicationPrivate::init();
474
475 initResources();
476
477 qt_is_tty_app = (application_type == QApplicationPrivate::Tty);
478 process_cmdline();
479
480 // Must be called before initialize()
481 QColormap::initialize();
482 initializeWidgetPalettesFromTheme();
483 qt_init_tooltip_palette();
484 QApplicationPrivate::initializeWidgetFontHash();
485
486 initialize();
487 eventDispatcher->startingUp();
488
489#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
490 // factory for accessible interfaces for widgets shipped with Qt
491 QAccessible::installFactory(&qAccessibleFactory);
492#endif
493
494}
495
496void qt_init_tooltip_palette()
497{
498#if QT_CONFIG(tooltip)
499 if (const QPalette *toolTipPalette = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformTheme()->palette(type: QPlatformTheme::ToolTipPalette))
500 QToolTip::setPalette(*toolTipPalette);
501#endif
502}
503
504extern void qRegisterWidgetsVariant();
505
506/*!
507 Initializes the QApplication object, called from the constructors.
508*/
509void QApplicationPrivate::initialize()
510{
511 is_app_running = false; // Starting up.
512
513 QWidgetPrivate::mapper = new QWidgetMapper;
514 QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets = new QWidgetSet;
515
516 // needed for a static build.
517 qRegisterWidgetsVariant();
518
519 // needed for widgets in QML
520 QAbstractDeclarativeData::setWidgetParent = QWidgetPrivate::setWidgetParentHelper;
521
522 if (application_type != QApplicationPrivate::Tty) {
523 if (!styleOverride.isEmpty()) {
524 if (auto *style = QStyleFactory::create(styleOverride.toLower())) {
525 QApplication::setStyle(style);
526 } else {
527 qWarning(msg: "QApplication: invalid style override '%s' passed, ignoring it.\n"
528 "\tAvailable styles: %s", qPrintable(styleOverride),
529 qPrintable(QStyleFactory::keys().join(", "_L1)));
530 }
531 }
532
533 // Trigger default style if none was set already
534 Q_UNUSED(QApplication::style());
535 }
536
537 if (qEnvironmentVariableIntValue(varName: "QT_USE_NATIVE_WINDOWS") > 0)
538 QCoreApplication::setAttribute(attribute: Qt::AA_NativeWindows);
539
540 if (!qt_is_tty_app)
541 initializeMultitouch();
542
543 if (QGuiApplication::desktopSettingsAware())
544 if (const QPlatformTheme *theme = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformTheme()) {
545 QApplicationPrivate::enabledAnimations = theme->themeHint(hint: QPlatformTheme::UiEffects).toInt();
546 }
547
548 is_app_running = true; // no longer starting up
549}
550
551void QApplicationPrivate::initializeWidgetFontHash()
552{
553 const QPlatformTheme *theme = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformTheme();
554 if (!theme)
555 return;
556 FontHash *fontHash = app_fonts();
557 fontHash->clear();
558
559 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::MenuFont))
560 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QMenu"), value: *font);
561 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::MenuBarFont))
562 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QMenuBar"), value: *font);
563 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::MenuItemFont))
564 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QMenuItem"), value: *font);
565 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::MessageBoxFont))
566 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QMessageBox"), value: *font);
567 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::LabelFont))
568 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QLabel"), value: *font);
569 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::TipLabelFont))
570 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QTipLabel"), value: *font);
571 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::TitleBarFont))
572 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QTitleBar"), value: *font);
573 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::StatusBarFont))
574 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QStatusBar"), value: *font);
575 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::MdiSubWindowTitleFont))
576 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QMdiSubWindowTitleBar"), value: *font);
577 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::DockWidgetTitleFont))
578 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QDockWidgetTitle"), value: *font);
579 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::PushButtonFont))
580 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QPushButton"), value: *font);
581 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::CheckBoxFont))
582 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QCheckBox"), value: *font);
583 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::RadioButtonFont))
584 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QRadioButton"), value: *font);
585 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::ToolButtonFont))
586 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QToolButton"), value: *font);
587 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::ItemViewFont))
588 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QAbstractItemView"), value: *font);
589 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::ListViewFont))
590 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QListView"), value: *font);
591 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::HeaderViewFont))
592 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QHeaderView"), value: *font);
593 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::ListBoxFont))
594 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QListBox"), value: *font);
595 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::ComboMenuItemFont))
596 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QComboMenuItem"), value: *font);
597 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::ComboLineEditFont))
598 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QComboLineEdit"), value: *font);
599 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::SmallFont))
600 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QSmallFont"), value: *font);
601 if (const QFont *font = theme->font(type: QPlatformTheme::MiniFont))
602 fontHash->insert(QByteArrayLiteral("QMiniFont"), value: *font);
603}
604
605/*****************************************************************************
606 Functions returning the active popup and modal widgets.
607 *****************************************************************************/
608
609/*!
610 Returns the active popup widget.
611
612 A popup widget is a special top-level widget that sets the \c
613 Qt::WType_Popup widget flag, e.g. the QMenu widget. When the application
614 opens a popup widget, all events are sent to the popup. Normal widgets and
615 modal widgets cannot be accessed before the popup widget is closed.
616
617 Only other popup widgets may be opened when a popup widget is shown. The
618 popup widgets are organized in a stack. This function returns the active
619 popup widget at the top of the stack.
620
621 \sa activeModalWidget(), topLevelWidgets()
622*/
623
624QWidget *QApplication::activePopupWidget()
625{
626 return QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets && !QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets->isEmpty() ?
627 QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets->constLast() : nullptr;
628}
629
630
631/*!
632 Returns the active modal widget.
633
634 A modal widget is a special top-level widget which is a subclass of QDialog
635 that specifies the modal parameter of the constructor as true. A modal
636 widget must be closed before the user can continue with other parts of the
637 program.
638
639 Modal widgets are organized in a stack. This function returns the active
640 modal widget at the top of the stack.
641
642 \sa activePopupWidget(), topLevelWidgets()
643*/
644
645QWidget *QApplication::activeModalWidget()
646{
647 QWidgetWindow *widgetWindow = qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: modalWindow());
648 return widgetWindow ? widgetWindow->widget() : nullptr;
649}
650
651/*!
652 Cleans up any window system resources that were allocated by this
653 application. Sets the global variable \c qApp to \nullptr.
654*/
655
656QApplication::~QApplication()
657{
658 Q_D(QApplication);
659
660 //### this should probable be done even later
661 qt_call_post_routines();
662
663 // kill timers before closing down the dispatcher
664 d->toolTipWakeUp.stop();
665 d->toolTipFallAsleep.stop();
666
667 QApplicationPrivate::is_app_closing = true;
668 QApplicationPrivate::is_app_running = false;
669
670 delete QWidgetPrivate::mapper;
671 QWidgetPrivate::mapper = nullptr;
672
673 // delete all widgets
674 if (QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets) {
675 QWidgetSet *mySet = QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets;
676 QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets = nullptr;
677 for (QWidgetSet::ConstIterator it = mySet->constBegin(), cend = mySet->constEnd(); it != cend; ++it) {
678 QWidget *w = *it;
679 if (!w->parent()) // window
680 w->destroy(destroyWindow: true, destroySubWindows: true);
681 }
682 delete mySet;
683 }
684
685 delete qt_desktopWidget;
686 qt_desktopWidget = nullptr;
687
688 QApplicationPrivate::widgetPalettes.clear();
689
690 delete QApplicationPrivate::sys_font;
691 QApplicationPrivate::sys_font = nullptr;
692 delete QApplicationPrivate::set_font;
693 QApplicationPrivate::set_font = nullptr;
694 app_fonts()->clear();
695
696 delete QApplicationPrivate::app_style;
697 QApplicationPrivate::app_style = nullptr;
698
699#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)
700 if (!qt_is_tty_app)
701 delete QDragManager::self();
702#endif
703
704 d->cleanupMultitouch();
705
706 qt_cleanup();
707
708 if (QApplicationPrivate::widgetCount)
709 qDebug(msg: "Widgets left: %i Max widgets: %i \n", QWidgetPrivate::instanceCounter, QWidgetPrivate::maxInstances);
710
711 QApplicationPrivate::obey_desktop_settings = true;
712
713 QApplicationPrivate::enabledAnimations = QPlatformTheme::GeneralUiEffect;
714 QApplicationPrivate::widgetCount = false;
715}
716
717void qt_cleanup()
718{
719 QPixmapCache::clear();
720 QColormap::cleanup();
721
722 QApplicationPrivate::active_window = nullptr; //### this should not be necessary
723}
724
725/*!
726 \fn QWidget *QApplication::widgetAt(const QPoint &point)
727
728 Returns the widget at global screen position \a point, or \nullptr
729 if there is no Qt widget there.
730
731 This function can be slow.
732
733 \sa QCursor::pos(), QWidget::grabMouse(), QWidget::grabKeyboard()
734*/
735QWidget *QApplication::widgetAt(const QPoint &p)
736{
737 QWidget *window = QApplication::topLevelAt(pos: p);
738 if (!window)
739 return nullptr;
740
741 QWidget *child = nullptr;
742
743 if (!window->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_TransparentForMouseEvents))
744 child = window->childAt(p: window->mapFromGlobal(p));
745
746 if (child)
747 return child;
748
749 if (window->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_TransparentForMouseEvents)) {
750 //shoot a hole in the widget and try once again,
751 //suboptimal on Qt for Embedded Linux where we do
752 //know the stacking order of the toplevels.
753 int x = p.x();
754 int y = p.y();
755 QRegion oldmask = window->mask();
756 QPoint wpoint = window->mapFromGlobal(QPoint(x, y));
757 QRegion newmask = (oldmask.isEmpty() ? QRegion(window->rect()) : oldmask)
758 - QRegion(wpoint.x(), wpoint.y(), 1, 1);
759 window->setMask(newmask);
760 QWidget *recurse = nullptr;
761 if (QApplication::topLevelAt(pos: p) != window) // verify recursion will terminate
762 recurse = widgetAt(x, y);
763 if (oldmask.isEmpty())
764 window->clearMask();
765 else
766 window->setMask(oldmask);
767 return recurse;
768 }
769 return window;
770}
771
772/*!
773 \fn QWidget *QApplication::widgetAt(int x, int y)
774
775 \overload
776
777 Returns the widget at global screen position (\a x, \a y), or
778 \nullptr if there is no Qt widget there.
779*/
780
781/*!
782 \internal
783*/
784bool QApplication::compressEvent(QEvent *event, QObject *receiver, QPostEventList *postedEvents)
785{
786 // Only compress the following events:
787 const QEvent::Type type = event->type();
788 switch (type) {
789 case QEvent::UpdateRequest:
790 case QEvent::LayoutRequest:
791 case QEvent::Resize:
792 case QEvent::Move:
793 case QEvent::LanguageChange:
794 break;
795 default:
796 return QGuiApplication::compressEvent(event, receiver, postedEvents);
797 }
798
799 for (const auto &postedEvent : std::as_const(t&: *postedEvents)) {
800
801 // Continue, unless a valid event of the same type exists for the same receiver
802 if (postedEvent.receiver != receiver
803 || !postedEvent.event
804 || postedEvent.event->type() != type) {
805 continue;
806 }
807
808 // Handle type specific compression
809 switch (type) {
810 case QEvent::Resize:
811 static_cast<QResizeEvent *>(postedEvent.event)->m_size =
812 static_cast<const QResizeEvent *>(event)->size();
813 break;
814 case QEvent::Move:
815 static_cast<QMoveEvent *>(postedEvent.event)->m_pos =
816 static_cast<const QMoveEvent *>(event)->pos();
817 break;
818 case QEvent::UpdateRequest:
819 case QEvent::LanguageChange:
820 case QEvent::LayoutRequest:
821 break;
822 default:
823 continue;
824 }
825 delete event;
826 return true;
827 }
828 return false;
829}

867#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
868
869QString QApplication::styleSheet() const
870{
871 return QApplicationPrivate::styleSheet;
872}
873
874void QApplication::setStyleSheet(const QString& styleSheet)
875{
876 QApplicationPrivate::styleSheet = styleSheet;
877 QStyleSheetStyle *styleSheetStyle = qt_styleSheet(style: QApplicationPrivate::app_style);
878 if (styleSheet.isEmpty()) { // application style sheet removed
879 if (!styleSheetStyle)
880 return; // there was no stylesheet before
881 setStyle(styleSheetStyle->base);
882 } else if (styleSheetStyle) { // style sheet update, just repolish
883 styleSheetStyle->repolish(qApp);
884 } else { // stylesheet set the first time
885 QStyleSheetStyle *newStyleSheetStyle = new QStyleSheetStyle(QApplicationPrivate::app_style);
886 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->setParent(newStyleSheetStyle);
887 setStyle(newStyleSheetStyle);
888 }
889}
890
891#endif // QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
892
893/*!
894 Returns the application's style object.
895
896 \sa setStyle(), QStyle
897*/
898QStyle *QApplication::style()
899{
900 if (!QApplicationPrivate::app_style) {
901 // Create default style
902 if (!qobject_cast<QApplication *>(object: QCoreApplication::instance())) {
903 Q_ASSERT(!"No style available without QApplication!");
904 return nullptr;
905 }
906
907 auto &defaultStyle = QApplicationPrivate::app_style;
908
909 defaultStyle = QStyleFactory::create(QApplicationPrivate::desktopStyleKey());
910 if (!defaultStyle) {
911 const QStringList styles = QStyleFactory::keys();
912 for (const auto &style : styles) {
913 if ((defaultStyle = QStyleFactory::create(style)))
914 break;
915 }
916 }
917 if (!defaultStyle) {
918 Q_ASSERT(!"No styles available!");
919 return nullptr;
920 }
921
922 // Take ownership of the style
923 defaultStyle->setParent(qApp);
924
925 QGuiApplicationPrivate::updatePalette();
926
927#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
928 if (!QApplicationPrivate::styleSheet.isEmpty()) {
929 qApp->setStyleSheet(QApplicationPrivate::styleSheet);
930 } else
931#endif
932 {
933 defaultStyle->polish(qApp);
934 }
935 }
936
937 return QApplicationPrivate::app_style;
938}
939
940/*!
941 Sets the application's GUI style to \a style. Ownership of the style object
942 is transferred to QApplication, so QApplication will delete the style
943 object on application exit or when a new style is set and the old style is
944 still the parent of the application object.
945
946 Example usage:
947 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qapplication.cpp 1
948
949 When switching application styles, the color palette is set back to the
950 initial colors or the system defaults. This is necessary since certain
951 styles have to adapt the color palette to be fully style-guide compliant.
952
953 Setting the style before a palette has been set, i.e., before creating
954 QApplication, will cause the application to use QStyle::standardPalette()
955 for the palette.
956
957 \warning Qt style sheets are currently not supported for custom QStyle
958 subclasses. We plan to address this in some future release.
959
960 \sa style(), QStyle, setPalette(), desktopSettingsAware()
961*/
962void QApplication::setStyle(QStyle *style)
963{
964 if (!style || style == QApplicationPrivate::app_style)
965 return;
966
967 QWidgetList all = allWidgets();
968
969 // clean up the old style
970 if (QApplicationPrivate::app_style) {
971 if (QApplicationPrivate::is_app_running && !QApplicationPrivate::is_app_closing) {
972 for (QWidgetList::ConstIterator it = all.constBegin(), cend = all.constEnd(); it != cend; ++it) {
973 QWidget *w = *it;
974 if (!(w->windowType() == Qt::Desktop) && // except desktop
975 w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Polished)) { // has been polished
976 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->unpolish(widget: w);
977 }
978 }
979 }
980 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->unpolish(qApp);
981 }
982
983 QStyle *old = QApplicationPrivate::app_style; // save
984
985#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
986 if (!QApplicationPrivate::styleSheet.isEmpty() && !qt_styleSheet(style)) {
987 // we have a stylesheet already and a new style is being set
988 QStyleSheetStyle *newStyleSheetStyle = new QStyleSheetStyle(style);
989 style->setParent(newStyleSheetStyle);
990 QApplicationPrivate::app_style = newStyleSheetStyle;
991 } else
992#endif // QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
993 QApplicationPrivate::app_style = style;
994 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->setParent(qApp); // take ownership
995
996 // Take care of possible palette requirements of certain
997 // styles. Do it before polishing the application since the
998 // style might call QApplication::setPalette() itself.
999 QGuiApplicationPrivate::updatePalette();
1000
1001 // The default widget font hash is based on the platform theme,
1002 // not the style, but the widget fonts could in theory have been
1003 // affected by polish of the previous style, without a proper
1004 // cleanup in unpolish, so reset it now before polishing the
1005 // new style.
1006 QApplicationPrivate::initializeWidgetFontHash();
1007
1008 // initialize the application with the new style
1009 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->polish(qApp);
1010
1011 // re-polish existing widgets if necessary
1012 if (QApplicationPrivate::is_app_running && !QApplicationPrivate::is_app_closing) {
1013 for (QWidgetList::ConstIterator it = all.constBegin(), cend = all.constEnd(); it != cend; ++it) {
1014 QWidget *w = *it;
1015 if (w->windowType() != Qt::Desktop && w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Polished)) {
1016 if (w->style() == QApplicationPrivate::app_style)
1017 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->polish(widget: w); // repolish
1018#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
1019 else
1020 w->setStyleSheet(w->styleSheet()); // touch
1021#endif
1022 }
1023 }
1024
1025 for (QWidgetList::ConstIterator it = all.constBegin(), cend = all.constEnd(); it != cend; ++it) {
1026 QWidget *w = *it;
1027 if (w->windowType() != Qt::Desktop && !w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetStyle)) {
1028 QEvent e(QEvent::StyleChange);
1029 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &e);
1030 w->update();
1031 }
1032 }
1033 }
1034
1035#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
1036 if (QStyleSheetStyle *oldStyleSheetStyle = qt_styleSheet(style: old)) {
1037 oldStyleSheetStyle->deref();
1038 } else
1039#endif
1040 if (old && old->parent() == qApp) {
1041 delete old;
1042 }
1043
1044 if (QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget) {
1045 QFocusEvent in(QEvent::FocusIn, Qt::OtherFocusReason);
1046 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget->style(), event: &in);
1047 QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget->update();
1048 }
1049}
1050
1051/*!
1052 \overload
1053
1054 Requests a QStyle object for \a style from the QStyleFactory.
1055
1056 The string must be one of the QStyleFactory::keys(), typically one of
1057 "windows", "windowsvista", "fusion", or "macos". Style
1058 names are case insensitive.
1059
1060 Returns \nullptr if an unknown \a style is passed, otherwise the QStyle object
1061 returned is set as the application's GUI style.
1062
1063 \warning To ensure that the application's style is set correctly, it is
1064 best to call this function before the QApplication constructor, if
1065 possible.
1066*/
1067QStyle* QApplication::setStyle(const QString& style)
1068{
1069 QStyle *s = QStyleFactory::create(style);
1070 if (!s)
1071 return nullptr;
1072
1073 setStyle(s);
1074 return s;
1075}
1076
1077// Widget specific palettes
1078QApplicationPrivate::PaletteHash QApplicationPrivate::widgetPalettes;
1079
1080QPalette QApplicationPrivate::basePalette() const
1081{
1082 // Start out with a palette based on the style, in case there's no theme
1083 // available, or so that we can fill in missing roles in the theme.
1084 QPalette palette = app_style ? app_style->standardPalette() : Qt::gray;
1085
1086 // Prefer theme palette if available, but fill in missing roles from style
1087 // for compatibility. Note that the style's standard palette is not prioritized
1088 // over the theme palette, as the documented way of applying the style's palette
1089 // is to set it explicitly using QApplication::setPalette().
1090 if (const QPalette *themePalette = platformTheme() ? platformTheme()->palette() : nullptr)
1091 palette = themePalette->resolve(other: palette);
1092
1093 // Finish off by letting the application style polish the palette. This will
1094 // not result in the polished palette becoming a user-set palette, as the
1095 // resulting base palette is only used as a fallback, with the resolve mask
1096 // set to 0.
1097 if (app_style)
1098 app_style->polish(palette);
1099
1100 return palette;
1101}
1102
1103/*!
1104 \fn QPalette QApplication::palette(const QWidget* widget)
1105
1106 If a \a widget is passed, the default palette for the widget's class is
1107 returned. This may or may not be the application palette. In most cases
1108 there is no special palette for certain types of widgets, but one notable
1109 exception is the popup menu under Windows, if the user has defined a
1110 special background color for menus in the display settings.
1111
1112 \sa setPalette(), QWidget::palette()
1113*/
1114QPalette QApplication::palette(const QWidget* w)
1115{
1116 auto &widgetPalettes = QApplicationPrivate::widgetPalettes;
1117 if (w && !widgetPalettes.isEmpty()) {
1118 auto it = widgetPalettes.constFind(key: w->metaObject()->className());
1119 const auto cend = widgetPalettes.constEnd();
1120 if (it != cend)
1121 return *it;
1122 for (it = widgetPalettes.constBegin(); it != cend; ++it) {
1123 if (w->inherits(classname: it.key()))
1124 return it.value();
1125 }
1126 }
1127 return palette();
1128}
1129
1130/*!
1131 \overload
1132
1133 Returns the palette for widgets of the given \a className.
1134
1135 \sa setPalette(), QWidget::palette()
1136*/
1137QPalette QApplication::palette(const char *className)
1138{
1139 auto &widgetPalettes = QApplicationPrivate::widgetPalettes;
1140 if (className && !widgetPalettes.isEmpty()) {
1141 auto it = widgetPalettes.constFind(key: className);
1142 if (it != widgetPalettes.constEnd())
1143 return *it;
1144 }
1145
1146 return QGuiApplication::palette();
1147}
1148
1149/*!
1150 Changes the application palette to \a palette.
1151
1152 If \a className is passed, the change applies only to widgets that inherit
1153 \a className (as reported by QObject::inherits()). If \a className is left
1154 0, the change affects all widgets, thus overriding any previously set class
1155 specific palettes.
1156
1157 The palette may be changed according to the current GUI style in
1158 QStyle::polish().
1159
1160 \warning Do not use this function in conjunction with \l{Qt Style Sheets}.
1161 When using style sheets, the palette of a widget can be customized using
1162 the "color", "background-color", "selection-color",
1163 "selection-background-color" and "alternate-background-color".
1164
1165 \note Some styles do not use the palette for all drawing, for instance, if
1166 they make use of native theme engines. This is the case for the
1167 Windows Vista and \macos styles.
1168
1169 \sa QWidget::setPalette(), palette(), QStyle::polish()
1170*/
1171void QApplication::setPalette(const QPalette &palette, const char* className)
1172{
1173 if (className) {
1174 QPalette polishedPalette = palette;
1175 if (QApplicationPrivate::app_style) {
1176 auto originalResolveMask = palette.resolveMask();
1177 QApplicationPrivate::app_style->polish(palette&: polishedPalette);
1178 polishedPalette.setResolveMask(originalResolveMask);
1179 }
1180
1181 QApplicationPrivate::widgetPalettes.insert(key: className, value: polishedPalette);
1182 if (qApp)
1183 qApp->d_func()->handlePaletteChanged(className);
1184 } else {
1185 QGuiApplication::setPalette(palette);
1186 }
1187}
1188
1189void QApplicationPrivate::handlePaletteChanged(const char *className)
1190{
1191 if (!is_app_running || is_app_closing)
1192 return;
1193
1194 // Setting the global application palette is documented to
1195 // reset any previously set class specific widget palettes.
1196 if (!className && !widgetPalettes.isEmpty())
1197 widgetPalettes.clear();
1198
1199 QGuiApplicationPrivate::handlePaletteChanged(className);
1200
1201 QEvent event(QEvent::ApplicationPaletteChange);
1202 const QWidgetList widgets = QApplication::allWidgets();
1203 for (auto widget : widgets) {
1204 if (!widget->isWindow() && widget->inherits(classname: className))
1205 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: widget, event: &event);
1206 }
1207
1208#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
1209 for (auto scene : std::as_const(t&: scene_list))
1210 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: scene, event: &event);
1211#endif
1212
1213 // Palette has been reset back to the default application palette,
1214 // so we need to reinitialize the widget palettes from the theme.
1215 if (!className && !testAttribute(flag: Qt::AA_SetPalette))
1216 initializeWidgetPalettesFromTheme();
1217}
1218
1219void QApplicationPrivate::initializeWidgetPalettesFromTheme()
1220{
1221 QPlatformTheme *platformTheme = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformTheme();
1222 if (!platformTheme)
1223 return;
1224
1225 widgetPalettes.clear();
1226
1227 struct ThemedWidget { const char *className; QPlatformTheme::Palette palette; };
1228
1229 static const ThemedWidget themedWidgets[] = {
1230 { .className: "QToolButton", .palette: QPlatformTheme::ToolButtonPalette },
1231 { .className: "QAbstractButton", .palette: QPlatformTheme::ButtonPalette },
1232 { .className: "QCheckBox", .palette: QPlatformTheme::CheckBoxPalette },
1233 { .className: "QRadioButton", .palette: QPlatformTheme::RadioButtonPalette },
1234 { .className: "QHeaderView", .palette: QPlatformTheme::HeaderPalette },
1235 { .className: "QAbstractItemView", .palette: QPlatformTheme::ItemViewPalette },
1236 { .className: "QMessageBoxLabel", .palette: QPlatformTheme::MessageBoxLabelPalette },
1237 { .className: "QTabBar", .palette: QPlatformTheme::TabBarPalette },
1238 { .className: "QLabel", .palette: QPlatformTheme::LabelPalette },
1239 { .className: "QGroupBox", .palette: QPlatformTheme::GroupBoxPalette },
1240 { .className: "QMenu", .palette: QPlatformTheme::MenuPalette },
1241 { .className: "QMenuBar", .palette: QPlatformTheme::MenuBarPalette },
1242 { .className: "QTextEdit", .palette: QPlatformTheme::TextEditPalette },
1243 { .className: "QTextControl", .palette: QPlatformTheme::TextEditPalette },
1244 { .className: "QLineEdit", .palette: QPlatformTheme::TextLineEditPalette },
1245 };
1246
1247 for (const auto themedWidget : themedWidgets) {
1248 if (auto *palette = platformTheme->palette(type: themedWidget.palette))
1249 QApplication::setPalette(palette: *palette, className: themedWidget.className);
1250 }
1251}
1252
1253/*!
1254 Returns the default application font.
1255
1256 \sa fontMetrics(), QWidget::font()
1257*/
1258QFont QApplication::font()
1259{
1260 return QGuiApplication::font();
1261}
1262
1263/*!
1264 \overload
1265
1266 Returns the default font for the \a widget. If a default font was not
1267 registered for the \a{widget}'s class, it returns the default font of
1268 its nearest registered superclass.
1269
1270 \sa fontMetrics(), setFont(), QWidget::setFont()
1271*/
1272
1273QFont QApplication::font(const QWidget *widget)
1274{
1275 typedef FontHash::const_iterator FontHashConstIt;
1276
1277 FontHash *hash = app_fonts();
1278
1279 if (widget && hash && hash->size()) {
1280#ifdef Q_OS_MAC
1281 // short circuit for small and mini controls
1282 if (widget->testAttribute(Qt::WA_MacSmallSize)) {
1283 return hash->value(QByteArrayLiteral("QSmallFont"));
1284 } else if (widget->testAttribute(Qt::WA_MacMiniSize)) {
1285 return hash->value(QByteArrayLiteral("QMiniFont"));
1286 }
1287#endif
1288 // Return the font for the nearest registered superclass
1289 const QMetaObject *metaObj = widget->metaObject();
1290 FontHashConstIt it = hash->constFind(key: metaObj->className());
1291 const FontHashConstIt cend = hash->constEnd();
1292 while (it == cend && metaObj != &QWidget::staticMetaObject) {
1293 metaObj = metaObj->superClass();
1294 it = hash->constFind(key: metaObj->className());
1295 }
1296 if (it != cend)
1297 return it.value();
1298 }
1299 return font();
1300}
1301
1302/*!
1303 \overload
1304
1305 Returns the font for widgets of the given \a className.
1306
1307 \sa setFont(), QWidget::font()
1308*/
1309QFont QApplication::font(const char *className)
1310{
1311 FontHash *hash = app_fonts();
1312 if (className && hash && hash->size()) {
1313 QHash<QByteArray, QFont>::ConstIterator it = hash->constFind(key: className);
1314 if (it != hash->constEnd())
1315 return *it;
1316 }
1317 return font();
1318}
1319
1320
1321/*!
1322 Changes the default application font to \a font. If \a className is passed,
1323 the change applies only to classes that inherit \a className (as reported
1324 by QObject::inherits()).
1325
1326 On application start-up, the default font depends on the window system. It
1327 can vary depending on both the window system version and the locale. This
1328 function lets you override the default font; but overriding may be a bad
1329 idea because, for example, some locales need extra large fonts to support
1330 their special characters.
1331
1332 \warning Do not use this function in conjunction with \l{Qt Style Sheets}.
1333 The font of an application can be customized using the "font" style sheet
1334 property. To set a bold font for all QPushButtons, set the application
1335 styleSheet() as "QPushButton { font: bold }"
1336
1337 \sa font(), fontMetrics(), QWidget::setFont()
1338*/
1339
1340void QApplication::setFont(const QFont &font, const char *className)
1341{
1342 FontHash *hash = app_fonts();
1343 if (!className) {
1344 QGuiApplication::setFont(font);
1345 if (hash && hash->size())
1346 hash->clear();
1347 } else if (hash) {
1348 hash->insert(key: className, value: font);
1349 }
1350 if (QApplicationPrivate::is_app_running && !QApplicationPrivate::is_app_closing) {
1351 QEvent e(QEvent::ApplicationFontChange);
1352 QWidgetList wids = QApplication::allWidgets();
1353 for (QWidgetList::ConstIterator it = wids.constBegin(), cend = wids.constEnd(); it != cend; ++it) {
1354 QWidget *w = *it;
1355 if (!w->isWindow() && w->inherits(classname: className)) // matching class
1356 sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &e);
1357 }
1358
1359#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
1360 // Send to all scenes as well.
1361 QList<QGraphicsScene *> &scenes = qApp->d_func()->scene_list;
1362 for (QList<QGraphicsScene *>::ConstIterator it = scenes.constBegin();
1363 it != scenes.constEnd(); ++it) {
1364 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: *it, event: &e);
1365 }
1366#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
1367 }
1368 if (!className && (!QApplicationPrivate::sys_font || !font.isCopyOf(*QApplicationPrivate::sys_font))) {
1369 if (!QApplicationPrivate::set_font)
1370 QApplicationPrivate::set_font = new QFont(font);
1371 else
1372 *QApplicationPrivate::set_font = font;
1373 }
1374}
1375
1376/*! \internal
1377*/
1378void QApplicationPrivate::setSystemFont(const QFont &font)
1379{
1380 if (!sys_font)
1381 sys_font = new QFont(font);
1382 else
1383 *sys_font = font;
1384
1385 if (!QApplicationPrivate::set_font)
1386 QApplication::setFont(font: *sys_font);
1387}
1388
1389/*! \internal
1390*/
1391QString QApplicationPrivate::desktopStyleKey()
1392{
1393#if defined(QT_BUILD_INTERNAL)
1394 // Allow auto-tests to override the desktop style
1395 if (qEnvironmentVariableIsSet("QT_DESKTOP_STYLE_KEY"))
1396 return QString::fromLocal8Bit(qgetenv("QT_DESKTOP_STYLE_KEY"));
1397#endif
1398
1399 // The platform theme might return a style that is not available, find
1400 // first valid one.
1401 if (const QPlatformTheme *theme = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformTheme()) {
1402 const QStringList availableKeys = QStyleFactory::keys();
1403 const auto styles = theme->themeHint(hint: QPlatformTheme::StyleNames).toStringList();
1404 for (const QString &style : styles) {
1405 if (availableKeys.contains(str: style, cs: Qt::CaseInsensitive))
1406 return style;
1407 }
1408 }
1409 return QString();
1410}
1411
1412void QApplicationPrivate::notifyWindowIconChanged()
1413{
1414 QEvent ev(QEvent::ApplicationWindowIconChange);
1415 const QWidgetList list = QApplication::topLevelWidgets();
1416 QWindowList windowList = QGuiApplication::topLevelWindows();
1417
1418 // send to all top-level QWidgets
1419 for (auto *w : list) {
1420 windowList.removeOne(t: w->windowHandle());
1421 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &ev);
1422 }
1423
1424 // in case there are any plain QWindows in this QApplication-using
1425 // application, also send the notification to them
1426 for (int i = 0; i < windowList.size(); ++i)
1427 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: windowList.at(i), event: &ev);
1428}

1430/*!
1431 Returns a list of the top-level widgets (windows) in the application.
1432
1433 \note Some of the top-level widgets may be hidden, for example a tooltip if
1434 no tooltip is currently shown.
1435
1436 Example:
1437
1438 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qapplication.cpp 4
1439
1440 \sa allWidgets(), QWidget::isWindow(), QWidget::isHidden()
1441*/
1442QWidgetList QApplication::topLevelWidgets()
1443{
1444 QWidgetList list;
1445 if (QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets != nullptr) {
1446 const auto isTopLevelWidget = [] (const QWidget *w) {
1447 return w->isWindow() && w->windowType() != Qt::Desktop;
1448 };
1449 std::copy_if(first: QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets->cbegin(), last: QWidgetPrivate::allWidgets->cend(),
1450 result: std::back_inserter(x&: list), pred: isTopLevelWidget);
1451 }
1452 return list;
1453}

1475/*!
1476 Returns the application widget that has the keyboard input focus,
1477 or \nullptr if no widget in this application has the focus.
1478
1479 \sa QWidget::setFocus(), QWidget::hasFocus(), activeWindow(), focusChanged()
1480*/
1481
1482QWidget *QApplication::focusWidget()
1483{
1484 return QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget;
1485}
1486
1487void QApplicationPrivate::setFocusWidget(QWidget *focus, Qt::FocusReason reason)
1488{
1489#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
1490 if (focus && focus->window()->graphicsProxyWidget())
1491 return;
1492#endif
1493
1494 hidden_focus_widget = nullptr;
1495
1496 if (focus != focus_widget) {
1497 if (focus && focus->isHidden()) {
1498 hidden_focus_widget = focus;
1499 return;
1500 }
1501
1502 if (focus && (reason == Qt::BacktabFocusReason || reason == Qt::TabFocusReason)
1503 && qt_in_tab_key_event)
1504 focus->window()->setAttribute(Qt::WA_KeyboardFocusChange);
1505 else if (focus && reason == Qt::ShortcutFocusReason) {
1506 focus->window()->setAttribute(Qt::WA_KeyboardFocusChange);
1507 }
1508 QWidget *prev = focus_widget;
1509 focus_widget = focus;
1510
1511 if (focus_widget)
1512 focus_widget->d_func()->setFocus_sys();
1513
1514 if (reason != Qt::NoFocusReason) {
1515
1516 //send events
1517 if (prev) {
1518#ifdef QT_KEYPAD_NAVIGATION
1519 if (QApplicationPrivate::keyboardNavigationEnabled()) {
1520 if (prev->hasEditFocus() && reason != Qt::PopupFocusReason)
1521 prev->setEditFocus(false);
1522 }
1523#endif
1524 QFocusEvent out(QEvent::FocusOut, reason);
1525 QPointer<QWidget> that = prev;
1526 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: prev, event: &out);
1527 if (that)
1528 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: that->style(), event: &out);
1529 }
1530 if (focus && QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget == focus) {
1531 QFocusEvent in(QEvent::FocusIn, reason);
1532 QPointer<QWidget> that = focus;
1533 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: focus, event: &in);
1534 if (that)
1535 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: that->style(), event: &in);
1536 }
1537 emit qApp->focusChanged(old: prev, now: focus_widget);
1538 }
1539 }
1540}

1570
1571bool QApplicationPrivate::tryCloseAllWidgetWindows(QWindowList *processedWindows)
1572{
1573 Q_ASSERT(processedWindows);
1574 while (QWidget *w = QApplication::activeModalWidget()) {
1575 if (!w->isVisible() || w->data->is_closing)
1576 break;
1577 QWindow *window = w->windowHandle();
1578 if (!window->close()) // Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose may cause deletion.
1579 return false;
1580 if (window)
1581 processedWindows->append(t: window);
1582 }
1583
1584retry:
1585 const QWidgetList list = QApplication::topLevelWidgets();
1586 for (auto *w : list) {
1587 if (w->isVisible() && w->windowType() != Qt::Desktop &&
1588 !w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen) && !w->data->is_closing) {
1589 QWindow *window = w->windowHandle();
1590 if (!window->close()) // Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose may cause deletion.
1591 return false;
1592 if (window)
1593 processedWindows->append(t: window);
1594 goto retry;
1595 }
1596 }
1597 return true;
1598}

1600/*!
1601 Closes all top-level windows.
1602
1603 This function is particularly useful for applications with many top-level
1604 windows.
1605
1606 The windows are closed in random order, until one window does not accept
1607 the close event. The application quits when the last window was successfully
1608 closed, unless \l quitOnLastWindowClosed is set to false. To trigger application
1609 termination from e.g. a menu, use QCoreApplication::quit() instead of this
1610 function.
1611
1612 \sa quitOnLastWindowClosed, lastWindowClosed(), QWidget::close(),
1613 QWidget::closeEvent(), lastWindowClosed(), QCoreApplication::quit(),
1614 topLevelWidgets(), QWidget::isWindow()
1615*/
1616void QApplication::closeAllWindows()
1617{
1618 QWindowList processedWindows;
1619 QApplicationPrivate::tryCloseAllWidgetWindows(processedWindows: &processedWindows);
1620}

1637
1638/*!
1639 \since 4.1
1640 \fn void QApplication::focusChanged(QWidget *old, QWidget *now)
1641
1642 This signal is emitted when the widget that has keyboard focus changed from
1643 \a old to \a now, i.e., because the user pressed the tab-key, clicked into
1644 a widget or changed the active window. Both \a old and \a now can be \nullptr.
1645
1646
1647 The signal is emitted after both widget have been notified about the change
1648 through QFocusEvent.
1649
1650 \sa QWidget::setFocus(), QWidget::clearFocus(), Qt::FocusReason
1651*/
1652
1653/*!\reimp
1654
1655*/
1656bool QApplication::event(QEvent *e)
1657{
1658 Q_D(QApplication);
1659 switch (e->type()) {
1660 case QEvent::Quit:
1661 // FIXME: This logic first tries to close all windows, and then
1662 // checks whether it was successful, but the conditions used in
1663 // closeAllWindows() differ from the verification logic below.
1664 // We should build on the logic in tryCloseAllWidgetWindows().
1665 closeAllWindows();
1666 for (auto *w : topLevelWidgets()) {
1667 if (w->data->is_closing)
1668 continue;
1669 if (w->isVisible() && !(w->windowType() == Qt::Desktop) && !(w->windowType() == Qt::Popup) &&
1670 (!(w->windowType() == Qt::Dialog) || !w->parentWidget()) && !w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)) {
1671 e->ignore();
1672 return true;
1673 }
1674 }
1675 // Explicitly call QCoreApplication instead of QGuiApplication so that
1676 // we don't let QGuiApplication close any windows we skipped earlier in
1677 // closeAllWindows(). FIXME: Unify all this close magic through closeAllWindows.
1678 return QCoreApplication::event(e);
1679#ifndef Q_OS_WIN
1680 case QEvent::LocaleChange: {
1681 // on Windows the event propagation is taken care by the
1682 // WM_SETTINGCHANGE event handler.
1683 const QWidgetList list = topLevelWidgets();
1684 for (auto *w : list) {
1685 if (!(w->windowType() == Qt::Desktop)) {
1686 if (!w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetLocale))
1687 w->d_func()->setLocale_helper(l: QLocale(), forceUpdate: true);
1688 }
1689 }
1690 break;
1691 }
1692#endif
1693 case QEvent::Timer: {
1694 QTimerEvent *te = static_cast<QTimerEvent*>(e);
1695 Q_ASSERT(te != nullptr);
1696 if (te->timerId() == d->toolTipWakeUp.timerId()) {
1697 d->toolTipWakeUp.stop();
1698 if (d->toolTipWidget) {
1699 QWidget *w = d->toolTipWidget->window();
1700 // show tooltip if WA_AlwaysShowToolTips is set, or if
1701 // any ancestor of d->toolTipWidget is the active
1702 // window
1703 bool showToolTip = w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_AlwaysShowToolTips);
1704 while (w && !showToolTip) {
1705 showToolTip = w->isActiveWindow();
1706 w = w->parentWidget();
1707 w = w ? w->window() : nullptr;
1708 }
1709 if (showToolTip) {
1710 QHelpEvent e(QEvent::ToolTip, d->toolTipPos, d->toolTipGlobalPos);
1711 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: d->toolTipWidget, event: &e);
1712 if (e.isAccepted()) {
1713 QStyle *s = d->toolTipWidget->style();
1714 int sleepDelay = s->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_ToolTip_FallAsleepDelay, opt: nullptr, widget: d->toolTipWidget, returnData: nullptr);
1715 d->toolTipFallAsleep.start(msec: sleepDelay, obj: this);
1716 }
1717 }
1718 }
1719 } else if (te->timerId() == d->toolTipFallAsleep.timerId()) {
1720 d->toolTipFallAsleep.stop();
1721 }
1722 break;
1723 }
1724#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
1725 case QEvent::EnterWhatsThisMode:
1726 QWhatsThis::enterWhatsThisMode();
1727 return true;
1728#endif
1729 case QEvent::LanguageChange:
1730 case QEvent::ApplicationFontChange:
1731 case QEvent::ApplicationPaletteChange: {
1732 // QGuiApplication::event does not account for the cases where
1733 // there is a top level widget without a window handle. So they
1734 // need to have the event posted here
1735 const QWidgetList list = topLevelWidgets();
1736 for (auto *w : list) {
1737 if (!w->windowHandle() && (w->windowType() != Qt::Desktop))
1738 postEvent(receiver: w, event: new QEvent(e->type()));
1739 }
1740 break;
1741 }
1742 default:
1743 break;
1744 }
1745
1746 return QGuiApplication::event(e);
1747}
1748
1749// ### FIXME: topLevelWindows does not contain QWidgets without a parent
1750// until QWidgetPrivate::create is called. So we have to override the
1751// QGuiApplication::notifyLayoutDirectionChange
1752// to do the right thing.
1753void QApplicationPrivate::notifyLayoutDirectionChange()
1754{
1755 const QWidgetList list = QApplication::topLevelWidgets();
1756 QWindowList windowList = QGuiApplication::topLevelWindows();
1757
1758 // send to all top-level QWidgets
1759 for (auto *w : list) {
1760 windowList.removeAll(t: w->windowHandle());
1761 QEvent ev(QEvent::ApplicationLayoutDirectionChange);
1762 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &ev);
1763 }
1764
1765 // in case there are any plain QWindows in this QApplication-using
1766 // application, also send the notification to them
1767 for (int i = 0; i < windowList.size(); ++i) {
1768 QEvent ev(QEvent::ApplicationLayoutDirectionChange);
1769 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: windowList.at(i), event: &ev);
1770 }
1771}
1772
1773/*!
1774 \fn void QApplication::setActiveWindow(QWidget* active)
1775 \deprecated Use QWidget::activateWindow() instead.
1776
1777 Sets the active window to the \a active widget in response to a system
1778 event. The function is called from the platform specific event handlers.
1779
1780 \warning This function does \e not set the keyboard focus to the active
1781 widget. Call QWidget::activateWindow() instead.
1782
1783 It sets the activeWindow() and focusWidget() attributes and sends proper
1784 \l{QEvent::WindowActivate}{WindowActivate}/\l{QEvent::WindowDeactivate}
1785 {WindowDeactivate} and \l{QEvent::FocusIn}{FocusIn}/\l{QEvent::FocusOut}
1786 {FocusOut} events to all appropriate widgets. The window will then be
1787 painted in active state (e.g. cursors in line edits will blink), and it
1788 will have tool tips enabled.
1789
1790 \sa activeWindow(), QWidget::activateWindow()
1791*/
1792#if QT_DEPRECATED_SINCE(6,5)
1793void QApplication::setActiveWindow(QWidget* act)
1794{
1795 QApplicationPrivate::setActiveWindow(act);
1796}
1797#endif
1798
1799void QApplicationPrivate::setActiveWindow(QWidget* act)
1800{
1801 QWidget* window = act?act->window():nullptr;
1802
1803 if (QApplicationPrivate::active_window == window)
1804 return;
1805
1806#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
1807 if (window && window->graphicsProxyWidget()) {
1808 // Activate the proxy's view->viewport() ?
1809 return;
1810 }
1811#endif
1812
1813 QWidgetList toBeActivated;
1814 QWidgetList toBeDeactivated;
1815
1816 if (QApplicationPrivate::active_window) {
1817 if (QApplication::style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Widget_ShareActivation, opt: nullptr, widget: QApplicationPrivate::active_window)) {
1818 const QWidgetList list = QApplication::topLevelWidgets();
1819 for (auto *w : list) {
1820 if (w->isVisible() && w->isActiveWindow())
1821 toBeDeactivated.append(t: w);
1822 }
1823 } else {
1824 toBeDeactivated.append(t: QApplicationPrivate::active_window);
1825 }
1826 }
1827
1828 if (QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget) {
1829 if (QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_InputMethodEnabled))
1830 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->commit();
1831
1832 QFocusEvent focusAboutToChange(QEvent::FocusAboutToChange, Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1833 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget, event: &focusAboutToChange);
1834 }
1835
1836 QApplicationPrivate::active_window = window;
1837
1838 if (QApplicationPrivate::active_window) {
1839 if (QApplication::style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Widget_ShareActivation, opt: nullptr, widget: QApplicationPrivate::active_window)) {
1840 const QWidgetList list = QApplication::topLevelWidgets();
1841 for (auto *w : list) {
1842 if (w->isVisible() && w->isActiveWindow())
1843 toBeActivated.append(t: w);
1844 }
1845 } else {
1846 toBeActivated.append(t: QApplicationPrivate::active_window);
1847 }
1848
1849 }
1850
1851 // first the activation/deactivation events
1852 QEvent activationChange(QEvent::ActivationChange);
1853 QEvent windowActivate(QEvent::WindowActivate);
1854 QEvent windowDeactivate(QEvent::WindowDeactivate);
1855
1856 for (int i = 0; i < toBeActivated.size(); ++i) {
1857 QWidget *w = toBeActivated.at(i);
1858 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: w, event: &windowActivate);
1859 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: w, event: &activationChange);
1860 }
1861
1862 for(int i = 0; i < toBeDeactivated.size(); ++i) {
1863 QWidget *w = toBeDeactivated.at(i);
1864 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: w, event: &windowDeactivate);
1865 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: w, event: &activationChange);
1866 }
1867
1868 if (QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets == nullptr) { // !inPopupMode()
1869 // then focus events
1870 if (!QApplicationPrivate::active_window && QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget) {
1871 QApplicationPrivate::setFocusWidget(focus: nullptr, reason: Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1872 } else if (QApplicationPrivate::active_window) {
1873 QWidget *w = QApplicationPrivate::active_window->focusWidget();
1874 if (w && w->isVisible() /*&& w->focusPolicy() != QWidget::NoFocus*/)
1875 w->setFocus(Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1876 else {
1877 w = QApplicationPrivate::focusNextPrevChild_helper(toplevel: QApplicationPrivate::active_window, next: true);
1878 if (w) {
1879 w->setFocus(Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1880 } else {
1881 w = QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget;
1882 if (!w && QApplicationPrivate::active_window->focusPolicy() != Qt::NoFocus) {
1883 QApplicationPrivate::active_window->setFocus(Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1884 } else if (!QApplicationPrivate::active_window->isAncestorOf(child: w)) {
1885 // If the focus widget is not in the activate_window, clear the focus
1886 QApplicationPrivate::setFocusWidget(focus: nullptr, reason: Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1887 }
1888 }
1889 }
1890 }
1891 }
1892}
1893
1894QWidget *qt_tlw_for_window(QWindow *wnd)
1895{
1896 // QTBUG-32177, wnd might be a QQuickView embedded via window container.
1897 while (wnd && !wnd->isTopLevel()) {
1898 QWindow *parent = wnd->parent();
1899 if (!parent)
1900 break;
1901
1902 // Don't end up in windows not belonging to this application
1903 if (parent->handle() && parent->handle()->isForeignWindow())
1904 break;
1905
1906 wnd = wnd->parent();
1907 }
1908 if (wnd) {
1909 const auto tlws = QApplication::topLevelWidgets();
1910 for (QWidget *tlw : tlws) {
1911 if (tlw->windowHandle() == wnd)
1912 return tlw;
1913 }
1914 }
1915 return nullptr;
1916}
1917
1918void QApplicationPrivate::notifyActiveWindowChange(QWindow *previous)
1919{
1920#ifndef Q_OS_MACOS
1921 // Some delayed focus event to ignore, unless we are on cocoa where
1922 // popups can be opened via right-click on inactive applications
1923 if (inPopupMode())
1924 return;
1925#endif
1926 QWindow *focusWindow = QGuiApplicationPrivate::focus_window;
1927 QWidget *focusWidget = qt_tlw_for_window(wnd: focusWindow);
1928 QApplicationPrivate::setActiveWindow(focusWidget);
1929 // QTBUG-37126, Active X controls may set the focus on native child widgets.
1930 if (focusWindow && focusWidget && focusWindow != focusWidget->windowHandle()) {
1931 if (QWidgetWindow *widgetWindow = qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: focusWindow))
1932 if (QWidget *widget = widgetWindow->widget())
1933 if (widget->inherits(classname: "QAxHostWidget"))
1934 widget->setFocus(Qt::ActiveWindowFocusReason);
1935 }
1936
1937 // QApplication::setActiveWindow() will deliver window activation events for
1938 // QWidgetWindows. But for other subclasses of QWindow (like QQuickWindow), we
1939 // need to send them explicitly, like we do from the base class implementation.
1940 if (previous && !qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: previous)) {
1941 QEvent de(QEvent::WindowDeactivate);
1942 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: previous, event: &de);
1943 }
1944
1945 if (focusWindow && !qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: focusWindow)) {
1946 QEvent ae(QEvent::WindowActivate);
1947 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: focusWindow, event: &ae);
1948 }
1949
1950 // don't call base class to avoid double delivery of WindowActivate/Deactivate events
1951}
1952
1953/*!internal
1954 * Helper function that returns the new focus widget, but does not set the focus reason.
1955 * Returns \nullptr if a new focus widget could not be found.
1956 * Shared with QGraphicsProxyWidgetPrivate::findFocusChild()
1957*/
1958QWidget *QApplicationPrivate::focusNextPrevChild_helper(QWidget *toplevel, bool next,
1959 bool *wrappingOccurred)
1960{
1961 uint focus_flag = qt_tab_all_widgets() ? Qt::TabFocus : Qt::StrongFocus;
1962
1963 QWidget *f = toplevel->focusWidget();
1964 if (!f)
1965 f = toplevel;
1966
1967 QWidget *w = f;
1968 QWidget *test = f->d_func()->focus_next;
1969 bool seenWindow = false;
1970 bool focusWidgetAfterWindow = false;
1971 while (test && test != f) {
1972 if (test->isWindow())
1973 seenWindow = true;
1974
1975 // If the next focus widget has a focus proxy, we need to check to ensure
1976 // that the proxy is in the correct parent-child direction (according to
1977 // \a next). This is to ensure that we can tab in and out of compound widgets
1978 // without getting stuck in a tab-loop between parent and child.
1979 QWidget *focusProxy = test->d_func()->deepestFocusProxy();
1980 auto effectiveFocusPolicy = [](QWidget *widget) {
1981 return widget->isEnabled() ? widget->focusPolicy() : Qt::NoFocus;
1982 };
1983 const bool canTakeFocus = (effectiveFocusPolicy(focusProxy ? focusProxy : test)
1984 & focus_flag) == focus_flag;
1985 const bool composites = focusProxy ? (next ? focusProxy->isAncestorOf(child: test)
1986 : test->isAncestorOf(child: focusProxy))
1987 : false;
1988 if (canTakeFocus && !composites
1989 && test->isVisibleTo(toplevel) && test->isEnabled()
1990 && !(w->windowType() == Qt::SubWindow && !w->isAncestorOf(child: test))
1991 && (toplevel->windowType() != Qt::SubWindow || toplevel->isAncestorOf(child: test))
1992 && f != focusProxy) {
1993 w = test;
1994 if (seenWindow)
1995 focusWidgetAfterWindow = true;
1996 if (next)
1997 break;
1998 }
1999 test = test->d_func()->focus_next;
2000 }
2001
2002 if (wrappingOccurred != nullptr)
2003 *wrappingOccurred = next ? focusWidgetAfterWindow : !focusWidgetAfterWindow;
2004
2005 if (w == f) {
2006 if (qt_in_tab_key_event) {
2007 w->window()->setAttribute(Qt::WA_KeyboardFocusChange);
2008 w->update();
2009 }
2010 return nullptr;
2011 }
2012 return w;
2013}
2014
2015/*!
2016 \fn void QApplicationPrivate::dispatchEnterLeave(QWidget* enter, QWidget* leave, const QPointF &globalPosF)
2017 \internal
2018
2019 Creates the proper Enter/Leave event when widget \a enter is entered and
2020 widget \a leave is left.
2021 */
2022void QApplicationPrivate::dispatchEnterLeave(QWidget* enter, QWidget* leave, const QPointF &globalPosF)
2023{
2024#if 0
2025 if (leave) {
2026 QEvent e(QEvent::Leave);
2027 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(leave, & e);
2028 }
2029 if (enter) {
2030 const QPoint windowPos = enter->window()->mapFromGlobal(globalPos);
2031 QEnterEvent e(enter->mapFromGlobal(globalPos), windowPos, globalPos);
2032 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(enter, & e);
2033 }
2034 return;
2035#endif
2036
2037 if ((!enter && !leave) || (enter == leave))
2038 return;
2039
2040 QWidgetList leaveList;
2041 QWidgetList enterList;
2042
2043 bool sameWindow = leave && enter && leave->window() == enter->window();
2044 if (leave && !sameWindow) {
2045 auto *w = leave;
2046 do {
2047 leaveList.append(t: w);
2048 } while (!w->isWindow() && (w = w->parentWidget()));
2049 }
2050 if (enter && !sameWindow) {
2051 auto *w = enter;
2052 do {
2053 enterList.append(t: w);
2054 } while (!w->isWindow() && (w = w->parentWidget()));
2055 }
2056 if (sameWindow) {
2057 int enterDepth = 0;
2058 int leaveDepth = 0;
2059 auto *e = enter;
2060 while (!e->isWindow() && (e = e->parentWidget()))
2061 enterDepth++;
2062 auto *l = leave;
2063 while (!l->isWindow() && (l = l->parentWidget()))
2064 leaveDepth++;
2065 QWidget* wenter = enter;
2066 QWidget* wleave = leave;
2067 while (enterDepth > leaveDepth) {
2068 wenter = wenter->parentWidget();
2069 enterDepth--;
2070 }
2071 while (leaveDepth > enterDepth) {
2072 wleave = wleave->parentWidget();
2073 leaveDepth--;
2074 }
2075 while (!wenter->isWindow() && wenter != wleave) {
2076 wenter = wenter->parentWidget();
2077 wleave = wleave->parentWidget();
2078 }
2079
2080 for (auto *w = leave; w != wleave; w = w->parentWidget())
2081 leaveList.append(t: w);
2082
2083 for (auto *w = enter; w != wenter; w = w->parentWidget())
2084 enterList.append(t: w);
2085 }
2086
2087 QEvent leaveEvent(QEvent::Leave);
2088 for (int i = 0; i < leaveList.size(); ++i) {
2089 auto *w = leaveList.at(i);
2090 if (!QApplication::activeModalWidget() || QApplicationPrivate::tryModalHelper(widget: w, rettop: nullptr)) {
2091 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &leaveEvent);
2092 if (w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_Hover) &&
2093 (!QApplication::activePopupWidget() || QApplication::activePopupWidget() == w->window())) {
2094 Q_ASSERT(instance());
2095 QHoverEvent he(QEvent::HoverLeave, QPointF(-1, -1), globalPosF, w->mapFromGlobal(globalPosF),
2096 QGuiApplication::keyboardModifiers());
2097 qApp->d_func()->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: &he);
2098 }
2099 }
2100 }
2101 if (!enterList.isEmpty()) {
2102 // Guard against QGuiApplicationPrivate::lastCursorPosition initialized to qInf(), qInf().
2103 const QPointF globalPos = qIsInf(d: globalPosF.x())
2104 ? QPointF(QWIDGETSIZE_MAX, QWIDGETSIZE_MAX)
2105 : globalPosF;
2106 const QPointF windowPos = std::as_const(t&: enterList).back()->window()->mapFromGlobal(globalPos);
2107 for (auto it = enterList.crbegin(), end = enterList.crend(); it != end; ++it) {
2108 auto *w = *it;
2109 if (!QApplication::activeModalWidget() || QApplicationPrivate::tryModalHelper(widget: w, rettop: nullptr)) {
2110 const QPointF localPos = w->mapFromGlobal(globalPos);
2111 QEnterEvent enterEvent(localPos, windowPos, globalPos);
2112 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &enterEvent);
2113 if (w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_Hover) &&
2114 (!QApplication::activePopupWidget() || QApplication::activePopupWidget() == w->window())) {
2115 QHoverEvent he(QEvent::HoverEnter, windowPos, QPointF(-1, -1), globalPos,
2116 QGuiApplication::keyboardModifiers());
2117 QMutableEventPoint::setPosition(p&: he.point(i: 0), arg: localPos);
2118 qApp->d_func()->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: &he);
2119 }
2120 }
2121 }
2122 }
2123
2124#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
2125 // Update cursor for alien/graphics widgets.
2126
2127 const bool enterOnAlien = (enter && (isAlien(widget: enter) || enter->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)));
2128 // Whenever we leave an alien widget on X11/QPA, we need to reset its nativeParentWidget()'s cursor.
2129 // This is not required on Windows as the cursor is reset on every single mouse move.
2130 QWidget *parentOfLeavingCursor = nullptr;
2131 for (int i = 0; i < leaveList.size(); ++i) {
2132 auto *w = leaveList.at(i);
2133 if (!isAlien(widget: w))
2134 break;
2135 if (w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetCursor)) {
2136 QWidget *parent = w->parentWidget();
2137 while (parent && parent->d_func()->data.in_destructor)
2138 parent = parent->parentWidget();
2139 parentOfLeavingCursor = parent;
2140 //continue looping, we need to find the downest alien widget with a cursor.
2141 // (downest on the screen)
2142 }
2143 }
2144 //check that we will not call qt_x11_enforce_cursor twice with the same native widget
2145 if (parentOfLeavingCursor && (!enterOnAlien
2146 || parentOfLeavingCursor->effectiveWinId() != enter->effectiveWinId())) {
2147#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
2148 if (!parentOfLeavingCursor->window()->graphicsProxyWidget())
2149#endif
2150 {
2151 if (enter == QApplicationPrivate::desktop()) {
2152 qt_qpa_set_cursor(w: enter, force: true);
2153 } else {
2154 qt_qpa_set_cursor(w: parentOfLeavingCursor, force: true);
2155 }
2156 }
2157 }
2158 if (enterOnAlien) {
2159 QWidget *cursorWidget = enter;
2160 while (!cursorWidget->isWindow() && !cursorWidget->isEnabled())
2161 cursorWidget = cursorWidget->parentWidget();
2162
2163 if (!cursorWidget)
2164 return;
2165
2166#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
2167 if (cursorWidget->window()->graphicsProxyWidget()) {
2168 QWidgetPrivate::nearestGraphicsProxyWidget(origin: cursorWidget)->setCursor(cursorWidget->cursor());
2169 } else
2170#endif
2171 {
2172 qt_qpa_set_cursor(w: cursorWidget, force: true);
2173 }
2174 }
2175#endif
2176}

2188{

2199bool QApplicationPrivate::windowNeverBlocked(QWindow *window) const
2200{
2201 QWidget *popupWidget = QApplication::activePopupWidget();
2202 QWindow *popupWindow = popupWidget ? popupWidget->windowHandle() : nullptr;
2203 return popupWindow == window || (!popupWindow && QWindowPrivate::get(window)->isPopup());

2206/*!\internal
2207
2208 Called from qapplication_\e{platform}.cpp, returns \c true
2209 if the widget should accept the event.
2210 */
2211bool QApplicationPrivate::tryModalHelper(QWidget *widget, QWidget **rettop)
2212{
2213 QWidget *top = QApplication::activeModalWidget();
2214 if (rettop)
2215 *rettop = top;
2216
2217 // the active popup widget always gets the input event
2218 if (QApplication::activePopupWidget())
2219 return true;
2220
2221 return !isBlockedByModal(widget: widget->window());
2222}
2223
2224bool qt_try_modal(QWidget *widget, QEvent::Type type)
2225{
2226 QWidget * top = nullptr;
2227
2228 if (QApplicationPrivate::tryModalHelper(widget, rettop: &top))
2229 return true;
2230
2231 bool block_event = false;
2232
2233 switch (type) {
2234 case QEvent::MouseButtonPress: // disallow mouse/key events
2235 case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
2236 case QEvent::MouseMove:
2237 case QEvent::KeyPress:
2238 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
2239 block_event = true;
2240 break;
2241 default:
2242 break;
2243 }
2244
2245 if (block_event && top && top->parentWidget() == nullptr)
2246 top->raise();
2247
2248 return !block_event;
2249}

2256/*
2257 \internal
2258*/
2259QWidget *QApplicationPrivate::pickMouseReceiver(QWidget *candidate, const QPoint &windowPos,
2260 QPoint *pos, QEvent::Type type,
2261 Qt::MouseButtons buttons, QWidget *buttonDown,
2262 QWidget *alienWidget)
2263{
2264 Q_ASSERT(candidate);
2265
2266 QWidget *mouseGrabber = QWidget::mouseGrabber();
2267 if (((type == QEvent::MouseMove && buttons) || (type == QEvent::MouseButtonRelease))
2268 && !buttonDown && !mouseGrabber) {
2269 return nullptr;
2270 }
2271
2272 if (alienWidget && alienWidget->internalWinId())
2273 alienWidget = nullptr;
2274
2275 QWidget *receiver = candidate;
2276
2277 if (!mouseGrabber)
2278 mouseGrabber = (buttonDown && !isBlockedByModal(widget: buttonDown)) ? buttonDown : alienWidget;
2279
2280 if (mouseGrabber && mouseGrabber != candidate) {
2281 receiver = mouseGrabber;
2282 *pos = receiver->mapFromGlobal(candidate->mapToGlobal(windowPos));
2283 }
2284
2285 return receiver;
2286
2287}
2288
2289/*
2290 \internal
2291*/
2292bool QApplicationPrivate::sendMouseEvent(QWidget *receiver, QMouseEvent *event,
2293 QWidget *alienWidget, QWidget *nativeWidget,
2294 QWidget **buttonDown, QPointer<QWidget> &lastMouseReceiver,
2295 bool spontaneous, bool onlyDispatchEnterLeave)
2296{
2297 Q_ASSERT(receiver);
2298 Q_ASSERT(event);
2299 Q_ASSERT(nativeWidget);
2300 Q_ASSERT(buttonDown);
2301
2302 if (alienWidget && !isAlien(widget: alienWidget))
2303 alienWidget = nullptr;
2304
2305 QPointer<QWidget> receiverGuard = receiver;
2306 QPointer<QWidget> nativeGuard = nativeWidget;
2307 QPointer<QWidget> alienGuard = alienWidget;
2308 QPointer<QWidget> activePopupWidget = QApplication::activePopupWidget();
2309
2310 const bool graphicsWidget = nativeWidget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen);
2311
2312 bool widgetUnderMouse = QRectF(receiver->rect()).contains(p: event->position());
2313
2314 // Clear the obsolete leaveAfterRelease value, if mouse button has been released but
2315 // leaveAfterRelease has not been updated.
2316 // This happens e.g. when modal dialog or popup is shown as a response to button click.
2317 if (leaveAfterRelease && !*buttonDown && !event->buttons())
2318 leaveAfterRelease = nullptr;
2319
2320 if (*buttonDown) {
2321 if (!graphicsWidget) {
2322 // Register the widget that shall receive a leave event
2323 // after the last button is released.
2324 if ((alienWidget || !receiver->internalWinId()) && !leaveAfterRelease && !QWidget::mouseGrabber())
2325 leaveAfterRelease = *buttonDown;
2326 if (event->type() == QEvent::MouseButtonRelease && !event->buttons())
2327 *buttonDown = nullptr;
2328 }
2329 } else if (lastMouseReceiver && widgetUnderMouse) {
2330 // Dispatch enter/leave if we move:
2331 // 1) from an alien widget to another alien widget or
2332 // from a native widget to an alien widget (first OR case)
2333 // 2) from an alien widget to a native widget (second OR case)
2334 if ((alienWidget && alienWidget != lastMouseReceiver)
2335 || (isAlien(widget: lastMouseReceiver) && !alienWidget)) {
2336 if (activePopupWidget) {
2337 if (!QWidget::mouseGrabber())
2338 dispatchEnterLeave(enter: alienWidget ? alienWidget : nativeWidget, leave: lastMouseReceiver, globalPosF: event->globalPosition());
2339 } else {
2340 dispatchEnterLeave(enter: receiver, leave: lastMouseReceiver, globalPosF: event->globalPosition());
2341 }
2342
2343 }
2344 }
2345
2346 // We need this quard in case someone opens a modal dialog / popup. If that's the case
2347 // leaveAfterRelease is set to null, but we shall not update lastMouseReceiver.
2348 const bool wasLeaveAfterRelease = leaveAfterRelease != nullptr;
2349 bool result = true;
2350 // This code is used for sending the synthetic enter/leave events for cases where it is needed
2351 // due to other events causing the widget under the mouse to change. However in those cases
2352 // we do not want to send the mouse event associated with this call, so this enables us to
2353 // not send the unneeded mouse event
2354 if (!onlyDispatchEnterLeave) {
2355 if (spontaneous)
2356 result = QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver, event);
2357 else
2358 result = QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver, event);
2359 }
2360
2361 if (!graphicsWidget && leaveAfterRelease && event->type() == QEvent::MouseButtonRelease
2362 && !event->buttons() && QWidget::mouseGrabber() != leaveAfterRelease) {
2363 // Dispatch enter/leave if:
2364 // 1) the mouse grabber is an alien widget
2365 // 2) the button is released on an alien widget
2366 QWidget *enter = nullptr;
2367 if (nativeGuard)
2368 enter = alienGuard ? alienWidget : nativeWidget;
2369 else // The receiver is typically deleted on mouse release with drag'n'drop.
2370 enter = QApplication::widgetAt(p: event->globalPosition().toPoint());
2371 dispatchEnterLeave(enter, leave: leaveAfterRelease, globalPosF: event->globalPosition());
2372 leaveAfterRelease = nullptr;
2373 lastMouseReceiver = enter;
2374 } else if (!wasLeaveAfterRelease) {
2375 if (activePopupWidget) {
2376 if (!QWidget::mouseGrabber())
2377 lastMouseReceiver = alienGuard ? alienWidget : (nativeGuard ? nativeWidget : nullptr);
2378 } else {
2379 lastMouseReceiver = receiverGuard ? receiver : QApplication::widgetAt(p: event->globalPosition().toPoint());
2380 }
2381 }
2382
2383 return result;
2384}
2385
2386/*
2387 This function should only be called when the widget changes visibility, i.e.
2388 when the \a widget is shown, hidden or deleted. This function does nothing
2389 if the widget is a top-level or native, i.e. not an alien widget. In that
2390 case enter/leave events are generated by the underlying windowing system.
2391*/
2392extern QPointer<QWidget> qt_last_mouse_receiver;
2393extern Q_WIDGETS_EXPORT QWidget *qt_button_down;
2394void QApplicationPrivate::sendSyntheticEnterLeave(QWidget *widget)
2395{
2396#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
2397 if (!widget || widget->isWindow())
2398 return;
2399 const bool widgetInShow = widget->isVisible() && !widget->data->in_destructor;
2400 if (!widgetInShow && widget != qt_last_mouse_receiver)
2401 return; // Widget was not under the cursor when it was hidden/deleted.
2402
2403 if (widgetInShow && widget->parentWidget()->data->in_show)
2404 return; // Ignore recursive show.
2405
2406 QWidget *mouseGrabber = QWidget::mouseGrabber();
2407 if (mouseGrabber && mouseGrabber != widget)
2408 return; // Someone else has the grab; enter/leave should not occur.
2409
2410 QWidget *tlw = widget->window();
2411 if (tlw->data->in_destructor || tlw->data->is_closing)
2412 return; // Closing down the business.
2413
2414 if (widgetInShow && (!qt_last_mouse_receiver || qt_last_mouse_receiver->window() != tlw))
2415 return; // Mouse cursor not inside the widget's top-level.
2416
2417 const QPoint globalPos(QCursor::pos());
2418 QPoint windowPos = tlw->mapFromGlobal(globalPos);
2419
2420 // Find the current widget under the mouse. If this function was called from
2421 // the widget's destructor, we have to make sure childAt() doesn't take into
2422 // account widgets that are about to be destructed.
2423 QWidget *widgetUnderCursor = tlw->d_func()->childAt_helper(windowPos, widget->data->in_destructor);
2424 if (!widgetUnderCursor)
2425 widgetUnderCursor = tlw;
2426 QPoint pos = widgetUnderCursor->mapFrom(tlw, windowPos);
2427
2428 if (widgetInShow && widgetUnderCursor != widget && !widget->isAncestorOf(child: widgetUnderCursor))
2429 return; // Mouse cursor not inside the widget or any of its children.
2430
2431 if (widget->data->in_destructor && qt_button_down == widget)
2432 qt_button_down = nullptr;
2433
2434 // A mouse move is not actually sent, but we utilize the sendMouseEvent() call to send the
2435 // enter/leave events as appropriate
2436 QMouseEvent e(QEvent::MouseMove, pos, windowPos, globalPos, Qt::NoButton, Qt::NoButton, Qt::NoModifier);
2437 sendMouseEvent(receiver: widgetUnderCursor, event: &e, alienWidget: widgetUnderCursor, nativeWidget: tlw, buttonDown: &qt_button_down, lastMouseReceiver&: qt_last_mouse_receiver, spontaneous: true, onlyDispatchEnterLeave: true);
2438#else // !QT_NO_CURSOR
2439 Q_UNUSED(widget);
2440#endif // QT_NO_CURSOR
2441}
2442
2443/*!
2444 \internal
2445
2446 Returns the desktop widget (also called the root window).
2447
2448 The widget represents the entire virtual desktop, and its geometry will
2449 be the union of all screens.
2450*/
2451QWidget *QApplicationPrivate::desktop()
2452{
2453 CHECK_QAPP_INSTANCE(nullptr)
2454 if (!qt_desktopWidget || // not created yet
2455 !(qt_desktopWidget->windowType() == Qt::Desktop)) { // reparented away
2456 qt_desktopWidget = new QWidget(nullptr, Qt::Desktop);
2457 }
2458 return qt_desktopWidget;
2459}

2505/*!
2506 \property QApplication::startDragDistance
2507 \brief the minimum distance required for a drag and drop operation to start.
2508
2509 If you support drag and drop in your application, and want to start a drag
2510 and drop operation after the user has moved the cursor a certain distance
2511 with a button held down, you should use this property's value as the
2512 minimum distance required.
2513
2514 For example, if the mouse position of the click is stored in \c startPos
2515 and the current position (e.g. in the mouse move event) is \c currentPos,
2516 you can find out if a drag should be started with code like this:
2517
2518 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qapplication.cpp 7
2519
2520 Qt uses this value internally, e.g. in QFileDialog.
2521
2522 The default value (if the platform doesn't provide a different default)
2523 is 10 pixels.
2524
2525 \sa startDragTime(), QPoint::manhattanLength(), {Drag and Drop in Qt}{Drag and Drop}
2526*/
2527
2528int QApplication::startDragDistance()
2529{
2530 return QGuiApplication::styleHints()->startDragDistance();
