2532
2533/*!
2534 Enters the main event loop and waits until exit() is called, then returns
2535 the value that was set to exit() (which is 0 if exit() is called via
2536 quit()).
2537
2538 It is necessary to call this function to start event handling. The main
2539 event loop receives events from the window system and dispatches these to
2540 the application widgets.
2541
2542 Generally, no user interaction can take place before calling exec(). As a
2543 special case, modal widgets like QMessageBox can be used before calling
2544 exec(), because modal widgets call exec() to start a local event loop.
2545
2546 To make your application perform idle processing, i.e., executing a special
2547 function whenever there are no pending events, use a QTimer with 0 timeout.
2548 More advanced idle processing schemes can be achieved using processEvents().
2549
2550 We recommend that you connect clean-up code to the
2551 \l{QCoreApplication::}{aboutToQuit()} signal, instead of putting it in your
2552 application's \c{main()} function. This is because, on some platforms the
2553 QApplication::exec() call may not return. For example, on the Windows
2554 platform, when the user logs off, the system terminates the process after Qt
2555 closes all top-level windows. Hence, there is \e{no guarantee} that the
2556 application will have time to exit its event loop and execute code at the
2557 end of the \c{main()} function, after the QApplication::exec() call.
2558
2559 \sa quitOnLastWindowClosed, QCoreApplication::quit(), QCoreApplication::exit(),
2560 QCoreApplication::processEvents(), QCoreApplication::exec()
2561*/
2562int QApplication::exec()
2563{
2564 return QGuiApplication::exec();
2565}
2566
2567/*! \reimp
2568 */
2569bool QApplication::notify(QObject *receiver, QEvent *e)
2570{
2571 Q_D(QApplication);
2572 // no events are delivered after ~QCoreApplication() has started
2573 if (QApplicationPrivate::is_app_closing)
2574 return true;
2575
2576 if (Q_UNLIKELY(!receiver)) { // serious error
2577 qWarning(msg: "QApplication::notify: Unexpected null receiver");
2578 return true;
2579 }
2580
2581#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG
2582 QCoreApplicationPrivate::checkReceiverThread(receiver);
2583#endif
2584
2585 const bool isWindowType = receiver->isWindowType();
2586 const bool isWidgetType = receiver->isWidgetType();
2587 if (isWindowType
2588 && QGuiApplicationPrivate::sendQWindowEventToQPlatformWindow(window: static_cast<QWindow *>(receiver), event: e)) {
2589 return true; // Platform plugin ate the event
2590 }
2591
2592 QGuiApplicationPrivate::captureGlobalModifierState(e);
2593
2594#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
2595 // walk through parents and check for gestures
2596 if (d->gestureManager) {
2597 switch (e->type()) {
2598 case QEvent::Paint:
2599 case QEvent::MetaCall:
2600 case QEvent::DeferredDelete:
2601 case QEvent::DragEnter: case QEvent::DragMove: case QEvent::DragLeave:
2602 case QEvent::Drop: case QEvent::DragResponse:
2603 case QEvent::ChildAdded: case QEvent::ChildPolished:
2604 case QEvent::ChildRemoved:
2605 case QEvent::UpdateRequest:
2606 case QEvent::UpdateLater:
2607 case QEvent::LocaleChange:
2608 case QEvent::Style:
2609 case QEvent::IconDrag:
2610 case QEvent::StyleChange:
2611 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragEnter:
2612 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragMove:
2613 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDragLeave:
2614 case QEvent::GraphicsSceneDrop:
2615 case QEvent::DynamicPropertyChange:
2616 case QEvent::NetworkReplyUpdated:
2617 break;
2618 default:
2619 if (d->gestureManager->thread() == QThread::currentThread()) {
2620 if (isWidgetType) {
2621 if (d->gestureManager->filterEvent(receiver: static_cast<QWidget *>(receiver), event: e))
2622 return true;
2623 } else {
2624 // a special case for events that go to QGesture objects.
2625 // We pass the object to the gesture manager and it'll figure
2626 // out if it's QGesture or not.
2627 if (d->gestureManager->filterEvent(receiver, event: e))
2628 return true;
2629 }
2630 }
2631 break;
2632 }
2633 }
2634#endif // QT_NO_GESTURES
2635
2636 switch (e->type()) {
2637 case QEvent::ApplicationDeactivate:
2638 case QEvent::OrientationChange:
2639 // Close all popups (triggers when switching applications
2640 // by pressing ALT-TAB on Windows, which is not receive as key event.
2641 // triggers when the screen rotates.)
2642 d->closeAllPopups();
2643 break;
2644 case QEvent::Wheel: // User input and window activation makes tooltips sleep
2645 case QEvent::ActivationChange:
2646 case QEvent::KeyPress:
2647 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
2648 case QEvent::FocusOut:
2649 case QEvent::FocusIn:
2650 case QEvent::MouseButtonPress:
2651 case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
2652 case QEvent::MouseButtonDblClick:
2653 d->toolTipFallAsleep.stop();
2654 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
2655 case QEvent::Leave:
2656 d->toolTipWakeUp.stop();
2657 default:
2658 break;
2659 }
2660
2661 switch (e->type()) {
2662 case QEvent::KeyPress: {
2663 QKeyEvent* keyEvent = static_cast<QKeyEvent*>(e);
2664 const int key = keyEvent->key();
2665 // When a key press is received which is not spontaneous then it needs to
2666 // be manually sent as a shortcut override event to ensure that any
2667 // matching shortcut is triggered first. This enables emulation/playback
2668 // of recorded events to still have the same effect.
2669 if (!e->spontaneous() && isWidgetType
2670 && qt_sendShortcutOverrideEvent(o: static_cast<QWidget *>(receiver), timestamp: keyEvent->timestamp(),
2671 k: key, mods: keyEvent->modifiers(), text: keyEvent->text(),
2672 autorep: keyEvent->isAutoRepeat(), count: keyEvent->count())) {
2673 return true;
2674 }
2675 qt_in_tab_key_event = (key == Qt::Key_Backtab
2676 || key == Qt::Key_Tab
2677 || key == Qt::Key_Left
2678 || key == Qt::Key_Up
2679 || key == Qt::Key_Right
2680 || key == Qt::Key_Down);
2681 }
2682 default:
2683 break;
2684 }
2685
2686 bool res = false;
2687 if (isWidgetType) {
2688 QWidget * w = static_cast<QWidget *>(receiver);
2689 switch (e->type()) {
2690 case QEvent::ShortcutOverride:
2691 case QEvent::KeyPress:
2692 case QEvent::KeyRelease: {
2693 QKeyEvent* key = static_cast<QKeyEvent*>(e);
2694 bool def = key->isAccepted();
2695 /*
2696 QLineEdit will emit a signal on Key_Return, but
2697 ignore the event, and sometimes the connected
2698 slot deletes the QLineEdit (common in itemview
2699 delegates), so we have to check if the widget
2700 was destroyed even if the event was ignored (to
2701 prevent a crash)
2702
2703 Note that we don't have to reset pr while
2704 propagating (because the original receiver will
2705 be destroyed if one of its ancestors is)
2706 */
2707 QPointer<QObject> pr = receiver;
2708 while (w) {
2709 if (def)
2710 key->accept();
2711 else
2712 key->ignore();
2713 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e);
2714
2715 if (res && key->isAccepted())
2716 break;
2717 if (!pr || w->isWindow())
2718 break;
2719
2720 w = w->parentWidget();
2721 }
2722 qt_in_tab_key_event = false;
2723 break;
2724 }
2725 case QEvent::MouseButtonPress:
2726 case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
2727 case QEvent::MouseButtonDblClick:
2728 case QEvent::MouseMove: {
2729 QMouseEvent* mouse = static_cast<QMouseEvent*>(e);
2730 QPoint relpos = mouse->position().toPoint();
2731
2732 if (e->spontaneous()) {
2733 if (e->type() != QEvent::MouseMove)
2734 QApplicationPrivate::giveFocusAccordingToFocusPolicy(w, event: e, localPos: relpos);
2735
2736 // ### Qt 7 These dynamic tool tips should be an OPT-IN feature. Some platforms
2737 // like macOS (probably others too), can optimize their views by not
2738 // dispatching mouse move events. We have attributes to control hover,
2739 // and mouse tracking, but as long as we are deciding to implement this
2740 // feature without choice of opting-in or out, you ALWAYS have to have
2741 // tracking enabled. Therefore, the other properties give a false sense of
2742 // performance enhancement.
2743 if (e->type() == QEvent::MouseMove && mouse->buttons() == 0
2744 && w->rect().contains(p: relpos)) { // Outside due to mouse grab?
2745 d->toolTipWidget = w;
2746 d->toolTipPos = relpos;
2747 d->toolTipGlobalPos = mouse->globalPosition().toPoint();
2748 QStyle *s = d->toolTipWidget->style();
2749 int wakeDelay = s->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_ToolTip_WakeUpDelay, opt: nullptr, widget: d->toolTipWidget, returnData: nullptr);
2750 d->toolTipWakeUp.start(msec: d->toolTipFallAsleep.isActive() ? 20 : wakeDelay, obj: this);
2751 }
2752 }
2753
2754 bool eventAccepted = mouse->isAccepted();
2755
2756 QPointer<QWidget> pw = w;
2757 while (w) {
2758 QMouseEvent me(mouse->type(), relpos, mouse->scenePosition(), mouse->globalPosition().toPoint(),
2759 mouse->button(), mouse->buttons(), mouse->modifiers(), mouse->source(),
2760 mouse->pointingDevice());
2761 me.m_spont = mouse->spontaneous();
2762 me.setTimestamp(mouse->timestamp());
2763 QMutableSinglePointEvent::from(e&: me).setDoubleClick(QMutableSinglePointEvent::from(e: mouse)->isDoubleClick());
2764 // throw away any mouse-tracking-only mouse events
2765 if (!w->hasMouseTracking()
2766 && mouse->type() == QEvent::MouseMove && mouse->buttons() == 0) {
2767 // but still send them through all application event filters (normally done by notify_helper)
2768 d->sendThroughApplicationEventFilters(w, w == receiver ? mouse : &me);
2769 res = true;
2770 } else {
2771 w->setAttribute(Qt::WA_NoMouseReplay, on: false);
2772 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: w == receiver ? mouse : &me);
2773 e->m_spont = false;
2774 }
2775 eventAccepted = (w == receiver ? mouse : &me)->isAccepted();
2776 if (res && eventAccepted)
2777 break;
2778 if (w->isWindow() || w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NoMousePropagation))
2779 break;
2780 relpos += w->pos();
2781 w = w->parentWidget();
2782 }
2783
2784 mouse->setAccepted(eventAccepted);
2785
2786 if (e->type() == QEvent::MouseMove) {
2787 if (!pw)
2788 break;
2789
2790 w = static_cast<QWidget *>(receiver);
2791 relpos = mouse->position().toPoint();
2792 QPoint diff = relpos - w->mapFromGlobal(mouse->globalPosition().toPoint());
2793 while (w) {
2794 if (w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_Hover) &&
2795 (!QApplication::activePopupWidget() || QApplication::activePopupWidget() == w->window())) {
2796 QHoverEvent he(QEvent::HoverMove, mouse->scenePosition(), mouse->globalPosition(), relpos - diff, mouse->modifiers());
2797 QMutableEventPoint::setPosition(p&: he.point(i: 0), arg: relpos);
2798 d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: &he);
2799 }
2800 if (w->isWindow() || w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NoMousePropagation))
2801 break;
2802 relpos += w->pos();
2803 w = w->parentWidget();
2804 }
2805 }
2806
2807 d->hoverGlobalPos = mouse->globalPosition().toPoint();
2808 break;
2809 }
2810#if QT_CONFIG(wheelevent)
2811 case QEvent::Wheel: {
2812 // QTBUG-40656, QTBUG-42731: ignore wheel events when a popup (QComboBox) is open.
2813 if (const QWidget *popup = QApplication::activePopupWidget()) {
2814 if (w->window() != popup)
2815 return true;
2816 }
2817
2818 QWheelEvent* wheel = static_cast<QWheelEvent*>(e);
2819 if (!wheel->spontaneous()) {
2820 /*
2821 Synthesized events shouldn't propagate, e.g. QScrollArea passes events from the
2822 viewport on to the scrollbars, which might ignore the event if there is no more
2823 space to scroll. If we would propagate, the event would come back to the viewport.
2824 */
2825 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: wheel);
2826 break;
2827 }
2828
2829 const Qt::ScrollPhase phase = wheel->phase();
2830 QPoint relpos = wheel->position().toPoint();
2831
2832 // Ideally, we should lock on a widget when it starts receiving wheel
2833 // events. This avoids other widgets to start receiving those events
2834 // as the mouse cursor hovers them. However, given the way common
2835 // wheeled mice work, there's no certain way of connecting different
2836 // wheel events as a stream. This results in the NoScrollPhase case,
2837 // where we just send the event from the original receiver and up its
2838 // hierarchy until the event gets accepted.
2839 //
2840 // In the case of more evolved input devices, like Apple's trackpad or
2841 // Magic Mouse, we receive the scroll phase information. This helps us
2842 // connect wheel events as a stream and therefore makes it easier to
2843 // lock on the widget onto which the scrolling was initiated.
2844 //
2845 // We assume that, when supported, the phase cycle follows the pattern:
2846 //
2847 // ScrollBegin (ScrollUpdate* ScrollMomentum* ScrollEnd)+
2848 //
2849 // This means that we can have scrolling sequences (starting with ScrollBegin)
2850 // or partial sequences (after a ScrollEnd and starting with ScrollUpdate).
2851
2852 // a widget has already grabbed the wheel for a sequence
2853 if (QApplicationPrivate::wheel_widget) {
2854 Q_ASSERT(phase != Qt::NoScrollPhase);
2855 w = QApplicationPrivate::wheel_widget;
2856 relpos = w->mapFromGlobal(wheel->globalPosition().toPoint());
2857 }
2858 /*
2859 Start or finish a scrolling sequence by grabbing/releasing the wheel via
2860 wheel_widget. The sequence might be partial (ie. not start with ScrollBegin),
2861 e.g. if the previous wheel_widget was destroyed mid-sequence.
2862 */
2863 switch (phase) {
2864 case Qt::ScrollEnd:
2865 QApplicationPrivate::wheel_widget = nullptr;
2866 break;
2867 case Qt::ScrollBegin:
2868 QApplicationPrivate::wheel_widget = w;
2869 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
2870 case Qt::ScrollUpdate:
2871 case Qt::ScrollMomentum:
2872 if (!QApplicationPrivate::wheel_widget)
2873 QApplicationPrivate::wheel_widget = w;
2874 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
2875 case Qt::NoScrollPhase:
2876 QApplicationPrivate::giveFocusAccordingToFocusPolicy(w, event: e, localPos: relpos);
2877 break;
2878 // no default: - we want warnings if we don't handle all phases explicitly
2879 }
2880
2881 QWheelEvent we(relpos, wheel->globalPosition(), wheel->pixelDelta(), wheel->angleDelta(), wheel->buttons(),
2882 wheel->modifiers(), phase, wheel->inverted(), wheel->source(), wheel->pointingDevice());
2883
2884 we.setTimestamp(wheel->timestamp());
2885 bool eventAccepted;
2886 do {
2887 // events are delivered as accepted and ignored by the default event handler
2888 // since we always send the same QWheelEvent object, we need to reset the accepted state
2889 we.setAccepted(true);
2890 we.m_spont = wheel->spontaneous() && w == receiver;
2891 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: &we);
2892 eventAccepted = we.isAccepted();
2893 if (res && eventAccepted)
2894 break;
2895 if (w->isWindow() || w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NoMousePropagation))
2896 break;
2897
2898 QMutableEventPoint::setPosition(p&: we.point(i: 0), arg: we.position() + w->pos());
2899 w = w->parentWidget();
2900 } while (w);
2901 wheel->setAccepted(eventAccepted);
2902 break;
2903 }
2904#endif
2905#ifndef QT_NO_CONTEXTMENU
2906 case QEvent::ContextMenu: {
2907 QContextMenuEvent *context = static_cast<QContextMenuEvent*>(e);
2908 QPoint relpos = context->pos();

2910 while (w) {

3000 QDragEnterEvent *dragEvent = static_cast<QDragEnterEvent *>(e);

3003 // and we must not change QDragManagers currentTarget.

3057 case QEvent::TouchBegin: {
3058 // Note: TouchUpdate and TouchEnd events are never propagated
3059 QMutableTouchEvent *touchEvent = QMutableTouchEvent::from(e: static_cast<QTouchEvent *>(e));
3060 bool eventAccepted = touchEvent->isAccepted();
3061 bool acceptTouchEvents = w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_AcceptTouchEvents);
3062
3063 if (acceptTouchEvents && e->spontaneous()) {
3064 const QPoint localPos = touchEvent->points()[0].position().toPoint();
3065 QApplicationPrivate::giveFocusAccordingToFocusPolicy(w, event: e, localPos);
3066 }

3069 QPointer<QWidget> gesturePendingWidget;
3070#endif

3073 // first, try to deliver the touch event
3074 acceptTouchEvents = w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_AcceptTouchEvents);
3075 touchEvent->setTarget(w);
3076 touchEvent->setAccepted(acceptTouchEvents);
3077 QPointer<QWidget> p = w;
3078 res = acceptTouchEvents && d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: touchEvent);
3079 eventAccepted = touchEvent->isAccepted();
3080 if (p.isNull()) {
3081 // widget was deleted
3082 w = nullptr;
3083 } else {
3084 w->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_AcceptedTouchBeginEvent, on: res && eventAccepted);
3085 }
3086 touchEvent->m_spont = false;
3087 if (res && eventAccepted) {
3088 // the first widget to accept the TouchBegin gets an implicit grab.
3089 d->activateImplicitTouchGrab(widget: w, touchBeginEvent: touchEvent);
3090 break;
3091 }
3092#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
3093 if (gesturePendingWidget.isNull() && w && QGestureManager::gesturePending(o: w))
3094 gesturePendingWidget = w;
3095#endif
3096 if (!w || w->isWindow() || w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NoMousePropagation))
3097 break;

3099 const QPoint offset = w->pos();
3100 w = w->parentWidget();
3101 touchEvent->setTarget(w);
3102 for (int i = 0; i < touchEvent->pointCount(); ++i) {
3103 auto &pt = touchEvent->point(i);
3104 QMutableEventPoint::setPosition(p&: pt, arg: pt.position() + offset);
3105 }
3106 }
3107
3108#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
3109 if (!eventAccepted && !gesturePendingWidget.isNull()) {
3110 // the first widget subscribed to a gesture gets an implicit grab for all
3111 // points, also for events and event points that have not been accepted.
3112 d->activateImplicitTouchGrab(widget: gesturePendingWidget, touchBeginEvent: touchEvent, grabMode: QApplicationPrivate::GrabAllPoints);
3113 }
3114#endif
3115
3116 touchEvent->setAccepted(eventAccepted);
3117 break;
3118 }
3119 case QEvent::TouchUpdate:
3120 case QEvent::TouchEnd:
3121 // We may get here if the widget is subscribed to a gesture,
3122 // but has not accepted TouchBegin. Propagate touch events
3123 // only if TouchBegin has been accepted.
3124 if (w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_AcceptedTouchBeginEvent))
3125 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e);
3126 break;
3127 case QEvent::RequestSoftwareInputPanel:
3128 inputMethod()->show();
3129 break;
3130 case QEvent::CloseSoftwareInputPanel:

3134#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
3135 case QEvent::NativeGesture:
3136 while (w) {
3137 e->ignore();
3138 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e);
3139 if (res && e->isAccepted())
3140 break;
3141 if (w->isWindow())
3142 break;
3143 w = w->parentWidget();
3144 }
3145 break;
3146 case QEvent::Gesture:
3147 case QEvent::GestureOverride: {
3148 QGestureEvent *gestureEvent = static_cast<QGestureEvent *>(e);
3149 QList<QGesture *> allGestures = gestureEvent->gestures();
3150
3151 bool eventAccepted = gestureEvent->isAccepted();
3152 bool wasAccepted = eventAccepted;
3153 while (w) {
3154 // send only gestures the widget expects
3155 QList<QGesture *> gestures;
3156 QWidgetPrivate *wd = w->d_func();
3157 for (int i = 0; i < allGestures.size();) {
3158 QGesture *g = allGestures.at(i);
3159 Qt::GestureType type = g->gestureType();
3160 QMap<Qt::GestureType, Qt::GestureFlags>::iterator contextit =
3161 wd->gestureContext.find(key: type);
3162 bool deliver = contextit != wd->gestureContext.end() &&
3163 (g->state() == Qt::GestureStarted || w == receiver ||
3164 (contextit.value() & Qt::ReceivePartialGestures));
3165 if (deliver) {
3166 allGestures.removeAt(i);
3167 gestures.append(t: g);
3168 } else {
3169 ++i;
3170 }
3171 }
3172 if (!gestures.isEmpty()) { // we have gestures for this w
3173 QGestureEvent ge(gestures);
3174 ge.t = gestureEvent->t;
3175 ge.m_spont = gestureEvent->spontaneous();
3176 ge.m_accept = wasAccepted;
3177 ge.m_accepted = gestureEvent->m_accepted;
3178 res = d->notify_helper(receiver: w, e: &ge);
3179 gestureEvent->m_spont = false;
3180 eventAccepted = ge.isAccepted();
3181 for (int i = 0; i < gestures.size(); ++i) {
3182 QGesture *g = gestures.at(i);
3183 // Ignore res [event return value] because handling of multiple gestures
3184 // packed into a single QEvent depends on not consuming the event
3185 if (eventAccepted || ge.isAccepted(g)) {
3186 // if the gesture was accepted, mark the target widget for it
3187 gestureEvent->m_targetWidgets[g->gestureType()] = w;
3188 gestureEvent->setAccepted(g, true);
3189 } else {
3190 // if the gesture was explicitly ignored by the application,
3191 // put it back so a parent can get it
3192 allGestures.append(t: g);
3193 }
3194 }
3195 }
3196 if (allGestures.isEmpty()) // everything delivered
3197 break;
3198 if (w->isWindow())
3199 break;
3200 w = w->parentWidget();
3201 }
3202 for (QGesture *g : std::as_const(t&: allGestures))
3203 gestureEvent->setAccepted(g, false);
3204 gestureEvent->m_accept = false; // to make sure we check individual gestures
3205 break;
3206 }
3207#endif // QT_NO_GESTURES
3208#ifdef Q_OS_MAC
3209 // Enable touch events on enter, disable on leave.
3210 typedef void (*RegisterTouchWindowFn)(QWindow *, bool);
3211 case QEvent::Enter:
3212 if (w->testAttribute(Qt::WA_AcceptTouchEvents)) {
3213 RegisterTouchWindowFn registerTouchWindow = reinterpret_cast<RegisterTouchWindowFn>
3214 (platformNativeInterface()->nativeResourceFunctionForIntegration("registertouchwindow"));
3215 if (registerTouchWindow)
3216 registerTouchWindow(w->window()->windowHandle(), true);
3217 }
3218 res = d->notify_helper(receiver, e);
3219 break;
3220 case QEvent::Leave:
3221 if (w->testAttribute(Qt::WA_AcceptTouchEvents)) {
3222 RegisterTouchWindowFn registerTouchWindow = reinterpret_cast<RegisterTouchWindowFn>
3223 (platformNativeInterface()->nativeResourceFunctionForIntegration("registertouchwindow"));
3224 if (registerTouchWindow)
3225 registerTouchWindow(w->window()->windowHandle(), false);
3226 }
3227 res = d->notify_helper(receiver, e);
3228 break;
3229#endif
3230 default:
3231 res = d->notify_helper(receiver, e);
3232 break;
3233 }
3234 } else {
3235 res = d->notify_helper(receiver, e);
3236 }
3237
3238 return res;
3239}
3240
3241bool QApplicationPrivate::notify_helper(QObject *receiver, QEvent * e)
3242{
3243 // These tracepoints (and the whole function, actually) are very similar
3244 // to the ones in QCoreApplicationPrivate::notify_helper; the reason for their
3245 // duplication is because tracepoint symbols are not exported by QtCore.
3246 // If you adjust the tracepoints here, consider adjusting QCoreApplicationPrivate too.
3247 Q_TRACE(QApplication_notify_entry, receiver, e, e->type());
3248 bool consumed = false;
3249 bool filtered = false;
3250 Q_TRACE_EXIT(QApplication_notify_exit, consumed, filtered);
3251
3252 // send to all application event filters
3253 if (threadRequiresCoreApplication()
3254 && receiver->d_func()->threadData.loadRelaxed()->thread.loadAcquire() == mainThread()
3255 && sendThroughApplicationEventFilters(receiver, e)) {
3256 filtered = true;
3257 return filtered;
3258 }
3259
3260 if (receiver->isWidgetType()) {
3261 QWidget *widget = static_cast<QWidget *>(receiver);
3262
3263#if !defined(QT_NO_CURSOR)
3264 // toggle HasMouse widget state on enter and leave
3265 if ((e->type() == QEvent::Enter || e->type() == QEvent::DragEnter) &&
3266 (!QApplication::activePopupWidget() || QApplication::activePopupWidget() == widget->window()))
3267 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_UnderMouse, on: true);
3268 else if (e->type() == QEvent::Leave || e->type() == QEvent::DragLeave)
3269 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_UnderMouse, on: false);
3270#endif
3271
3272 if (QLayout *layout=widget->d_func()->layout) {
3273 layout->widgetEvent(e);
3274 }
3275 }
3276
3277 // send to all receiver event filters
3278 if (sendThroughObjectEventFilters(receiver, e)) {
3279 filtered = true;
3280 return filtered;
3281 }
3282
3283 // deliver the event
3284 consumed = receiver->event(event: e);
3285
3286 QCoreApplicationPrivate::setEventSpontaneous(e, spontaneous: false);
3287 return consumed;
3288}
3289
3290bool QApplicationPrivate::inPopupMode()
3291{
3292 return QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets != nullptr;
3293}
3294
3295static void ungrabKeyboardForPopup(QWidget *popup)
3296{
3297 if (QWidget::keyboardGrabber())
3298 qt_widget_private(widget: QWidget::keyboardGrabber())->stealKeyboardGrab(grab: true);
3299 else
3300 qt_widget_private(widget: popup)->stealKeyboardGrab(grab: false);
3301}
3302
3303static void ungrabMouseForPopup(QWidget *popup)
3304{
3305 if (QWidget::mouseGrabber())
3306 qt_widget_private(widget: QWidget::mouseGrabber())->stealMouseGrab(grab: true);
3307 else
3308 qt_widget_private(widget: popup)->stealMouseGrab(grab: false);
3309}
3310
3311static bool popupGrabOk;
3312
3313static void grabForPopup(QWidget *popup)
3314{
3315 Q_ASSERT(popup->testAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Created));
3316 popupGrabOk = qt_widget_private(widget: popup)->stealKeyboardGrab(grab: true);
3317 if (popupGrabOk) {
3318 popupGrabOk = qt_widget_private(widget: popup)->stealMouseGrab(grab: true);
3319 if (!popupGrabOk) {
3320 // transfer grab back to the keyboard grabber if any
3321 ungrabKeyboardForPopup(popup);
3322 }
3323 }
3324}
3325
3326extern QWidget *qt_popup_down;
3327extern bool qt_replay_popup_mouse_event;
3328extern bool qt_popup_down_closed;
3329
3330bool QApplicationPrivate::closeAllPopups()
3331{
3332 // Close all popups: In case some popup refuses to close,
3333 // we give up after 1024 attempts (to avoid an infinite loop).
3334 int maxiter = 1024;
3335 QWidget *popup;
3336 while ((popup = QApplication::activePopupWidget()) && maxiter--)
3337 popup->close(); // this will call QApplicationPrivate::closePopup
3338 return true;
3339}
3340
3341void QApplicationPrivate::closePopup(QWidget *popup)
3342{
3343 if (!popupWidgets)
3344 return;
3345 popupWidgets->removeAll(t: popup);
3346
3347 if (popup == qt_popup_down) {
3348 qt_button_down = nullptr;
3349 qt_popup_down_closed = true;
3350 qt_popup_down = nullptr;
3351 }
3352
3353 if (QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets->size() == 0) { // this was the last popup
3354 delete QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets;
3355 QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets = nullptr;
3356 qt_popup_down_closed = false;
3357
3358 if (popupGrabOk) {
3359 popupGrabOk = false;
3360
3361 // TODO on multi-seat window systems, we have to know which mouse
3362 auto devPriv = QPointingDevicePrivate::get(q: QPointingDevice::primaryPointingDevice());
3363 auto mousePressPos = devPriv->pointById(id: 0)->eventPoint.globalPressPosition();
3364 if (popup->geometry().contains(p: mousePressPos.toPoint())
3365 || popup->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NoMouseReplay)) {
3366 // mouse release event or inside
3367 qt_replay_popup_mouse_event = false;
3368 } else { // mouse press event
3369 qt_replay_popup_mouse_event = true;
3370 }
3371
3372 // transfer grab back to mouse grabber if any, otherwise release the grab
3373 ungrabMouseForPopup(popup);
3374
3375 // transfer grab back to keyboard grabber if any, otherwise release the grab
3376 ungrabKeyboardForPopup(popup);
3377 }
3378
3379 if (active_window) {
3380 if (QWidget *fw = active_window->focusWidget()) {
3381 if (fw != QApplication::focusWidget()) {
3382 fw->setFocus(Qt::PopupFocusReason);
3383 } else {
3384 QFocusEvent e(QEvent::FocusIn, Qt::PopupFocusReason);
3385 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: fw, event: &e);
3386 }
3387 }
3388 }
3389
3390 } else {
3391 // A popup was closed, so the previous popup gets the focus.
3392 QWidget* aw = QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets->constLast();
3393 if (QWidget *fw = aw->focusWidget())
3394 fw->setFocus(Qt::PopupFocusReason);
3395
3396 // can become nullptr due to setFocus() above
3397 if (QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets &&
3398 QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets->size() == 1) // grab mouse/keyboard
3399 grabForPopup(popup: aw);
3400 }
3401
3402}
3403
3404int openPopupCount = 0;
3405
3406void QApplicationPrivate::openPopup(QWidget *popup)
3407{
3408 openPopupCount++;
3409 if (!popupWidgets) // create list
3410 popupWidgets = new QWidgetList;
3411 popupWidgets->append(t: popup); // add to end of list
3412
3413 if (QApplicationPrivate::popupWidgets->size() == 1) // grab mouse/keyboard
3414 grabForPopup(popup);
3415
3416 // popups are not focus-handled by the window system (the first
3417 // popup grabbed the keyboard), so we have to do that manually: A
3418 // new popup gets the focus
3419 if (popup->focusWidget()) {
3420 popup->focusWidget()->setFocus(Qt::PopupFocusReason);
3421 } else if (popupWidgets->size() == 1) { // this was the first popup
3422 if (QWidget *fw = QApplication::focusWidget()) {
3423 QFocusEvent e(QEvent::FocusOut, Qt::PopupFocusReason);
3424 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: fw, event: &e);
3425 }
3426 }
3427}

3455/*!
3456 \fn void QApplication::alert(QWidget *widget, int msec)
3457 \since 4.3
3458
3459 Causes an alert to be shown for \a widget if the window is not the active
3460 window. The alert is shown for \a msec milliseconds. If \a msec is zero (the
3461 default), then the alert is shown indefinitely until the window becomes
3462 active again.
3463
3464 Currently this function does nothing on Qt for Embedded Linux.
3465
3466 On \macos, this works more at the application level and will cause the
3467 application icon to bounce in the dock.
3468
3469 On Windows, this causes the window's taskbar entry to flash for a time. If
3470 \a msec is zero, the flashing will stop and the taskbar entry will turn a
3471 different color (currently orange).
3472
3473 On X11, this will cause the window to be marked as "demands attention", the
3474 window must not be hidden (i.e. not have hide() called on it, but be
3475 visible in some sort of way) in order for this to work.
3476*/
3477void QApplication::alert(QWidget *widget, int duration)
3478{
3479 if (widget) {
3480 if (widget->window()->isActiveWindow() && !(widget->window()->windowState() & Qt::WindowMinimized))
3481 return;
3482 if (QWindow *window= QApplicationPrivate::windowForWidget(widget))
3483 window->alert(msec: duration);
3484 } else {
3485 const auto topLevels = topLevelWidgets();
3486 for (QWidget *topLevel : topLevels)
3487 QApplication::alert(widget: topLevel, duration);
3488 }
3489}

3491/*!
3492 \property QApplication::cursorFlashTime
3493 \brief the text cursor's flash (blink) time in milliseconds
3494
3495 The flash time is the time required to display, invert and restore the
3496 caret display. Usually the text cursor is displayed for half the cursor
3497 flash time, then hidden for the same amount of time, but this may vary.
3498
3499 The default value on X11 is 1000 milliseconds. On Windows, the
3500 \uicontrol{Control Panel} value is used and setting this property sets the cursor
3501 flash time for all applications.
3502
3503 We recommend that widgets do not cache this value as it may change at any
3504 time if the user changes the global desktop settings.
3505
3506 \note This property may hold a negative value, for instance if cursor
3507 blinking is disabled.
3508*/
3509void QApplication::setCursorFlashTime(int msecs)
3510{
3511 QGuiApplication::styleHints()->setCursorFlashTime(msecs);
3512}

3585static inline int uiEffectToFlag(Qt::UIEffect effect)
3586{
3587 switch (effect) {
3588 case Qt::UI_General:
3589 return QPlatformTheme::GeneralUiEffect;
3590 case Qt::UI_AnimateMenu:
3591 return QPlatformTheme::AnimateMenuUiEffect;
3592 case Qt::UI_FadeMenu:
3593 return QPlatformTheme::FadeMenuUiEffect;
3594 case Qt::UI_AnimateCombo:
3595 return QPlatformTheme::AnimateComboUiEffect;
3596 case Qt::UI_AnimateTooltip:
3597 return QPlatformTheme::AnimateTooltipUiEffect;
3598 case Qt::UI_FadeTooltip:
3599 return QPlatformTheme::FadeTooltipUiEffect;
3600 case Qt::UI_AnimateToolBox:
3601 return QPlatformTheme::AnimateToolBoxUiEffect;
3602 }
3603 return 0;
3604}
3605
3606/*!
3607 \fn void QApplication::setEffectEnabled(Qt::UIEffect effect, bool enable)
3608
3609 Enables the UI effect \a effect if \a enable is true, otherwise the effect
3610 will not be used.
3611
3612 \note All effects are disabled on screens running at less than 16-bit color
3613 depth.
3614
3615 \sa isEffectEnabled(), Qt::UIEffect, setDesktopSettingsAware()
3616*/
3617void QApplication::setEffectEnabled(Qt::UIEffect effect, bool enable)
3618{
3619 int effectFlags = uiEffectToFlag(effect);
3620 if (enable) {
3621 if (effectFlags & QPlatformTheme::FadeMenuUiEffect)
3622 effectFlags |= QPlatformTheme::AnimateMenuUiEffect;
3623 if (effectFlags & QPlatformTheme::FadeTooltipUiEffect)
3624 effectFlags |= QPlatformTheme::AnimateTooltipUiEffect;
3625 QApplicationPrivate::enabledAnimations |= effectFlags;
3626 } else {
3627 QApplicationPrivate::enabledAnimations &= ~effectFlags;
3628 }
3629}
3630
3631/*!
3632 \fn bool QApplication::isEffectEnabled(Qt::UIEffect effect)
3633
3634 Returns \c true if \a effect is enabled; otherwise returns \c false.
3635
3636 By default, Qt will try to use the desktop settings. To prevent this, call
3637 setDesktopSettingsAware(false).
3638
3639 \note All effects are disabled on screens running at less than 16-bit color
3640 depth.
3641
3642 \sa setEffectEnabled(), Qt::UIEffect
3643*/
3644bool QApplication::isEffectEnabled(Qt::UIEffect effect)
3645{
3646 CHECK_QAPP_INSTANCE(false)
3647 return QColormap::instance().depth() >= 16
3648 && (QApplicationPrivate::enabledAnimations & QPlatformTheme::GeneralUiEffect)
3649 && (QApplicationPrivate::enabledAnimations & uiEffectToFlag(effect));
3650}

3678
3679void QApplicationPrivate::giveFocusAccordingToFocusPolicy(QWidget *widget, QEvent *event, QPoint localPos)
3680{
3681 const bool setFocusOnRelease = QGuiApplication::styleHints()->setFocusOnTouchRelease();
3682 Qt::FocusPolicy focusPolicy = Qt::ClickFocus;
3683 static QPointer<QWidget> focusedWidgetOnTouchBegin = nullptr;
3684
3685 switch (event->type()) {
3686 case QEvent::MouseButtonPress:
3687 case QEvent::MouseButtonDblClick:
3688 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
3689 focusedWidgetOnTouchBegin = QApplication::focusWidget();
3690 if (setFocusOnRelease)
3691 return;
3692 break;
3693 case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
3694 case QEvent::TouchEnd:
3695 if (!setFocusOnRelease)
3696 return;
3697 if (focusedWidgetOnTouchBegin != QApplication::focusWidget()) {
3698 // Focus widget was changed while delivering press/move events.
3699 // To not interfere with application logic, we leave focus as-is
3700 return;
3701 }
3702 break;
3703 case QEvent::Wheel:
3704 focusPolicy = Qt::WheelFocus;
3705 break;
3706 default:
3707 return;
3708 }
3709
3710 QWidget *focusWidget = widget;
3711 while (focusWidget) {
3712 if (focusWidget->isEnabled()
3713 && focusWidget->rect().contains(p: localPos)
3714 && QApplicationPrivate::shouldSetFocus(w: focusWidget, policy: focusPolicy)) {
3715 focusWidget->setFocus(Qt::MouseFocusReason);
3716 break;
3717 }
3718 if (focusWidget->isWindow())
3719 break;
3720
3721 // find out whether this widget (or its proxy) already has focus
3722 QWidget *f = focusWidget;
3723 if (focusWidget->d_func()->extra && focusWidget->d_func()->extra->focus_proxy)
3724 f = focusWidget->d_func()->extra->focus_proxy;
3725 // if it has, stop here.
3726 // otherwise a click on the focused widget would remove its focus if ClickFocus isn't set
3727 if (f->hasFocus())
3728 break;
3729
3730 localPos += focusWidget->pos();
3731 focusWidget = focusWidget->parentWidget();
3732 }
3733}
3734
3735bool QApplicationPrivate::shouldSetFocus(QWidget *w, Qt::FocusPolicy policy)
3736{
3737 QWidget *f = w;
3738 while (f->d_func()->extra && f->d_func()->extra->focus_proxy)
3739 f = f->d_func()->extra->focus_proxy;
3740
3741 if ((w->focusPolicy() & policy) != policy)
3742 return false;
3743 if (w != f && (f->focusPolicy() & policy) != policy)
3744 return false;
3745 return true;
3746}
3747
3748bool QApplicationPrivate::updateTouchPointsForWidget(QWidget *widget, QTouchEvent *touchEvent)
3749{
3750 bool containsPress = false;
3751
3752 for (int i = 0; i < touchEvent->pointCount(); ++i) {
3753 auto &pt = touchEvent->point(i);
3754 QMutableEventPoint::setPosition(p&: pt, arg: widget->mapFromGlobal(pt.globalPosition()));
3755
3756 if (pt.state() == QEventPoint::State::Pressed)
3757 containsPress = true;
3758 }
3759 return containsPress;
3760}

3779
3780QWidget *QApplicationPrivate::findClosestTouchPointTarget(const QPointingDevice *device, const QEventPoint &touchPoint)
3781{
3782 const QPointF globalPos = touchPoint.globalPosition();
3783 int closestTouchPointId = -1;
3784 QObject *closestTarget = nullptr;
3785 qreal closestDistance = 0;
3786 const QPointingDevicePrivate *devPriv = QPointingDevicePrivate::get(q: device);
3787 for (auto &epd : devPriv->activePoints.values()) {
3788 const auto &pt = epd.eventPoint;
3789 if (pt.id() != touchPoint.id()) {
3790 qreal dx = globalPos.x() - pt.globalPosition().x();
3791 qreal dy = globalPos.y() - pt.globalPosition().y();
3792 qreal distance = dx * dx + dy * dy;
3793 if (closestTouchPointId == -1 || distance < closestDistance) {
3794 closestTouchPointId = pt.id();
3795 closestDistance = distance;
3796 closestTarget = QMutableEventPoint::target(p: pt);
3797 }
3798 }
3799 }
3800 return static_cast<QWidget *>(closestTarget);
3801}
3802
3803void QApplicationPrivate::activateImplicitTouchGrab(QWidget *widget, QTouchEvent *touchEvent,
3804 ImplicitTouchGrabMode grabMode)
3805{
3806 if (touchEvent->type() != QEvent::TouchBegin)
3807 return;
3808
3809 // If the widget dispatched the event further (see QGraphicsProxyWidget), then
3810 // there might already be an implicit grabber. Don't override that. A widget that
3811 // has partially recognized a gesture needs to grab all points.
3812 for (int i = 0; i < touchEvent->pointCount(); ++i) {
3813 auto &ep = touchEvent->point(i);
3814 if (!QMutableEventPoint::target(p: ep) && (ep.isAccepted() || grabMode == GrabAllPoints))
3815 QMutableEventPoint::setTarget(p&: ep, arg: widget);
3816 }
3817 // TODO setExclusiveGrabber() to be consistent with Qt Quick?
3818}
3819
3820bool QApplicationPrivate::translateRawTouchEvent(QWidget *window, const QTouchEvent *te)
3821{
3822 QApplicationPrivate *d = self;
3823 // TODO get rid of this QPair
3824 typedef QPair<QEventPoint::State, QList<QEventPoint> > StatesAndTouchPoints;
3825 QHash<QWidget *, StatesAndTouchPoints> widgetsNeedingEvents;
3826
3827 const auto *device = te->pointingDevice();
3828 auto touchPoints = te->points(); // touch points will be mutated
3829 for (auto &touchPoint : touchPoints) {
3830 // update state
3831 QPointer<QObject> target;
3832 if (touchPoint.state() == QEventPoint::State::Pressed) {
3833 if (device->type() == QInputDevice::DeviceType::TouchPad) {
3834 // on touchpads, send all touch points to the same widget:
3835 // pick the first non-null target if possible
3836 target = QPointingDevicePrivate::get(q: device)->firstActiveTarget();
3837 }
3838
3839 if (target.isNull()) {
3840 // determine which widget this event will go to
3841 if (!window)
3842 window = QApplication::topLevelAt(pos: touchPoint.globalPosition().toPoint());
3843 if (!window)
3844 continue;
3845 target = window->childAt(p: window->mapFromGlobal(touchPoint.globalPosition().toPoint()));
3846 if (!target)
3847 target = window;
3848 }
3849
3850 bool usingClosestWidget = false;
3851 if (device->type() == QInputDevice::DeviceType::TouchScreen) {
3852 QWidget *closestWidget = d->findClosestTouchPointTarget(device, touchPoint);
3853 QWidget *widget = static_cast<QWidget *>(target.data());
3854 if (closestWidget
3855 && (widget->isAncestorOf(child: closestWidget) || closestWidget->isAncestorOf(child: widget))) {
3856 target = closestWidget;
3857 usingClosestWidget = true;
3858 }
3859 }
3860
3861 // on touch pads, implicitly grab all touch points
3862 // on touch screens, grab touch points that are redirected to the closest widget
3863 if (device->type() == QInputDevice::DeviceType::TouchPad || usingClosestWidget)
3864 QMutableEventPoint::setTarget(p&: touchPoint, arg: target);
3865 } else {
3866 target = QMutableEventPoint::target(p: touchPoint);
3867 if (!target)
3868 continue;
3869 }
3870 Q_ASSERT(!target.isNull());
3871
3872 QWidget *targetWidget = static_cast<QWidget *>(target.data());
3873
3874#ifdef Q_OS_MACOS
3875 // Single-touch events are normally not sent unless WA_TouchPadAcceptSingleTouchEvents is set.
3876 // In Qt 4 this check was in OS X-only code. That behavior is preserved here by the #ifdef.
3877 if (touchPoints.count() == 1
3878 && device->type() == QInputDevice::DeviceType::TouchPad
3879 && !targetWidget->testAttribute(Qt::WA_TouchPadAcceptSingleTouchEvents))
3880 continue;
3881#endif
3882
3883 StatesAndTouchPoints &maskAndPoints = widgetsNeedingEvents[targetWidget];
3884 maskAndPoints.first = QEventPoint::State(maskAndPoints.first | touchPoint.state());
3885 maskAndPoints.second.append(t: touchPoint);
3886 }
3887
3888 if (widgetsNeedingEvents.isEmpty())
3889 return false;
3890
3891 bool accepted = false;
3892 QHash<QWidget *, StatesAndTouchPoints>::ConstIterator it = widgetsNeedingEvents.constBegin();
3893 const QHash<QWidget *, StatesAndTouchPoints>::ConstIterator end = widgetsNeedingEvents.constEnd();
3894 for (; it != end; ++it) {
3895 const QPointer<QWidget> widget = it.key();
3896 if (!QApplicationPrivate::tryModalHelper(widget, rettop: nullptr))
3897 continue;
3898
3899 QEvent::Type eventType;
3900 switch (it.value().first) {
3901 case QEventPoint::State::Pressed:
3902 eventType = QEvent::TouchBegin;
3903 break;
3904 case QEventPoint::State::Released:
3905 eventType = QEvent::TouchEnd;
3906 break;
3907 case QEventPoint::State::Stationary:
3908 // don't send the event if nothing changed
3909 continue;
3910 default:
3911 eventType = QEvent::TouchUpdate;
3912 break;
3913 }
3914
3915 QMutableTouchEvent touchEvent(eventType, device, QGuiApplication::keyboardModifiers(),
3916 it.value().second);
3917 bool containsPress = updateTouchPointsForWidget(widget, touchEvent: &touchEvent);
3918 touchEvent.setTimestamp(te->timestamp());
3919 touchEvent.setTarget(widget);
3920
3921 if (containsPress)
3922 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_AcceptedTouchBeginEvent);
3923
3924 switch (touchEvent.type()) {
3925 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
3926 {
3927 // if the TouchBegin handler recurses, we assume that means the event
3928 // has been implicitly accepted and continue to send touch events
3929 bool res = te->spontaneous() ? QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &touchEvent)
3930 : QApplication::sendEvent(receiver: widget, event: &touchEvent);
3931 if (res && touchEvent.isAccepted()) {
3932 accepted = true;
3933 if (!widget.isNull())
3934 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_AcceptedTouchBeginEvent);
3935 }
3936 break;
3937 }
3938 default:
3939 if (widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_AcceptedTouchBeginEvent)
3940#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
3941 || QGestureManager::gesturePending(o: widget)
3942#endif
3943 ) {
3944 bool res = te->spontaneous() ? QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &touchEvent)
3945 : QApplication::sendEvent(receiver: widget, event: &touchEvent);
3946 if (res && touchEvent.isAccepted())
3947 accepted = true;
3948 // widget can be deleted on TouchEnd
3949 if (touchEvent.type() == QEvent::TouchEnd && !widget.isNull())
3950 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_AcceptedTouchBeginEvent, on: false);
3951 }
3952 break;
3953 }
3954 }
3955 return accepted;
3956}
3957
3958void QApplicationPrivate::translateTouchCancel(const QPointingDevice *device, ulong timestamp)
3959{
3960 QMutableTouchEvent touchEvent(QEvent::TouchCancel, device, QGuiApplication::keyboardModifiers());
3961 touchEvent.setTimestamp(timestamp);
3962
3963 QSet<QWidget *> widgetsNeedingCancel;
3964 const QPointingDevicePrivate *devPriv = QPointingDevicePrivate::get(q: device);
3965 for (auto &epd : devPriv->activePoints.values()) {
3966 const auto &pt = epd.eventPoint;
3967 QObject *target = QMutableEventPoint::target(p: pt);
3968 if (target && target->isWidgetType())
3969 widgetsNeedingCancel.insert(value: static_cast<QWidget *>(target));
3970 }
3971 for (QSet<QWidget *>::const_iterator widIt = widgetsNeedingCancel.constBegin(),
3972 widItEnd = widgetsNeedingCancel.constEnd(); widIt != widItEnd; ++widIt) {
3973 QWidget *widget = *widIt;
3974 touchEvent.setTarget(widget);
3975 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &touchEvent);
3976 }
3977}

4000QGestureManager* QGestureManager::instance(InstanceCreation ic)
4001{

4003 if (!qAppPriv)
4004 return nullptr;
4005 if (!qAppPriv->gestureManager && ic == ForceCreation)
4006 qAppPriv->gestureManager = new QGestureManager(qApp);

4008}
